１ぱつ　１０まん　キロカロリーの\nクリームの　ミサイルを　らんしゃ。\nあびると　あたまが　クラクラするぞ。
ほおぶくろの　でんきは　あくタイプの\nエネルギーに　へんか。　おなかが\nすきすぎて　とっても　きょうぼう。
くうふくホルモンで　せいしつが\nへんか。　おなかが　みたされるまで\nあくの　かぎりを　つくす。
はなの　なかに　みっちり　つまった\nエネルギーを　ふんしゃさせると\nやまが　ふきとび　ちけいが　かわる。
キョダイマックスした　きょだいな\nはなは　きょだい　けんぞうぶつも\nいちげきで　かいたいしてしまう。
まてんろうの　ごとく　きょだいか。\nあふれる　エネルギーで　からだの\nいちぶが　はっこう　している。
さいぼうのこうどは　はがねタイプの\nポケモンの　なかでも　トップクラス。\nじしんにも　つよい　こうぞうなのだ。
２ほんの　ふとい　ツルを　ふりまわし\nたたかう。　１０かいだての　ビルを\nかるく　なぎたおすほど　パワフルだ。
やまの　ふんかのような　いきおいで\nばらまく　たいりょうの　かふんは\nすいこみすぎると　きを　うしなうぞ。
せいみつな　しゃげきは　ニガテ。\n３１もんの　たいほうで　うってうって\nうちまくる　スタイルで　せめるのだ。
まんなかの　しゅほうから　はなたれる\nみずでっぽうは　やまを　うちぬき\nあなを　あける　はかいりょくだ。
キョダイマックスの　パワーによって\nきりかぶは　せいちょうして　まるで\nしんりんのような　ドラムに　なった。
ゴリランダーは　もりのドラムと\nひとつとなり　ガラルぜんどを　ゆらす\nドラムビートを　きざみつづける。
エースバーンの　もえる　とうしが\nのりうつった　キョダイかえんボールは\nあいてを　のがさず　まるやきにする。
キョダイマックスの　パワーによって\nかえんの　ボールは　ちょっけい\n１００メートルを　こえることもある。
みずでっぽうの　そくどは　マッハ７。\nあたまの　とさかで　かぜや　きおんを\nかんちしながら　ねらいを　さだめる。
そげきの　うでまえは　バツグン。\n１５キロさきに　ころがる　きのみを\nうちぬくのも　あさめしまえだ。
いかりのけしん　と　よばれている。\nすさまじい　ぎょうそうと　おたけびで\nせかいの　じゃきを　はらうという。
こぶしから　はなたれた　エネルギーが\nしょうげきはとなり　ダイマックスした\nポケモンを　いちげきで　ふきとばす。
むれを　はなれ　にんげんの　こどもを\nそだてる。　こどもが　なきやむ\nにおいの　ついた　ぬのを　まく。
あかんぼうの　ころから　そだてている\nにんげんの　ひろいごを　おもう\nきもちが　とくべつな　ちからとなる。
かぶっているのは　パートナーの\nぼうし。　いろんな　せかいを　たびした\nおもいでが　たくさん　つまっている。
あいぼうの　ぼうしを　かぶっている。\nいろんな　せかいを　ともに　たびする\nたいせつな　あかし　なのだ。
かたあしだちの　かまえで　ぴくりとも\nうごかず　キョダイマックスパワーを\nばくはつさせる　ときを　まっている。
いかりを　ひめた　めで　にらまれた\nだけで　よこしまな　こころの　ものは\nいのちを　うばわれてしまうという。
There is a plant seed on its back right from the\nday this Pokémon is born. The seed slowly\ngrows larger.
While it is young, it uses the nutrients that are\nstored in the seed on its back in order to grow.
When the bulb on its back grows large, it\nappears to lose the ability to stand on its\nhind legs.
Exposure to sunlight adds to its strength.\nSunlight also makes the bud on its back\ngrow larger.
Its plant blooms when it is absorbing solar\nenergy. It stays on the move to seek sunlight.
A bewitching aroma wafts from its flower.\nThe fragrance becalms those engaged\nin a battle.
It has a preference for hot things. When it rains,\nsteam is said to spout from the tip of its tail.
From the time it is born, a flame burns at the tip\nof its tail. Its life would end if the flame were to\ngo out.
It has a barbaric nature. In battle, it whips its\nfiery tail around and slashes away with sharp claws.
If it becomes agitated during battle, it spouts\nintense flames, incinerating its surroundings.
It spits fire that is hot enough to melt boulders.\nIt may cause forest fires by blowing flames.
Its wings can carry this Pokémon close to an\naltitude of 4,600 feet. It blows out fire at very\nhigh temperatures.
When it retracts its long neck into its shell, it\nsquirts out water with vigorous force.
When it feels threatened, it draws its limbs inside\nits shell and sprays water from its mouth.
It is recognized as a symbol of longevity. If its\nshell has algae on it, that Wartortle is very old.
It cleverly controls its furry ears and tail to\nmaintain its balance while swimming.
It crushes its foe under its heavy body to cause\nfainting. In a pinch, it will withdraw inside its shell.
The rocket cannons on its shell fire jets of water\ncapable of punching holes through thick steel.
For protection, it releases a horrible stench from\nthe antenna on its head to drive away enemies.
Its short feet are tipped with suction pads that\nenable it to tirelessly climb slopes and walls.
It is waiting for the moment to evolve. At this\nstage, it can only harden, so it remains\nmotionless to avoid attack.
Even though it is encased in a sturdy shell,\nthe body inside is tender. It can’t withstand a\nharsh attack.
In battle, it flaps its wings at great speed to\nrelease highly toxic dust into the air.
It collects honey every day. It rubs honey onto\nthe hairs on its legs to carry it back to its nest.
Pikachu that can generate powerful electricity\nhave cheek sacs that are extra soft and\nsuper stretchy.
When Pikachu meet, they’ll touch their tails\ntogether and exchange electricity through them\nas a form of greeting.
Its long tail serves as a ground to protect itself\nfrom its own high-voltage power.
If its electric pouches run empty, it raises its tail\nto gather electricity from the atmosphere.
It loves to bathe in the grit of dry, sandy areas.\nBy sand bathing, the Pokémon rids itself of dirt\nand moisture clinging to its body.
It burrows into the ground to create its nest. If\nhard stones impede its tunneling, it uses its sharp\nclaws to shatter them and then carries on digging.
The drier the area Sandslash lives in, the harder\nand smoother the Pokémon’s spikes will feel\nwhen touched.
It climbs trees by hooking on with its sharp claws.\nSandslash shares the berries it gathers, dropping\nthem down to Sandshrew waiting below the tree.
Females are more sensitive to smells than males.\nWhile foraging, they’ll use their whiskers to check\nwind direction and stay downwind of predators.
It uses its hard incisor teeth to crush and eat\nberries. The tip of a female Nidoran’s horn is a\nbit more rounded than the tip of a male’s horn.
The horn on its head has atrophied. It’s thought\nthat this happens so Nidorina’s children won’t get\npoked while their mother is feeding them.
If the group is threatened, these Pokémon will\nband together to assault enemies with a chorus\nof ultrasonic waves.
Nidoqueen is better at defense than offense.\nWith scales like armor, this Pokémon will shield\nits children from any kind of attack.
It pacifies offspring by placing them in the gaps\nbetween the spines on its back. The spines will\nnever secrete poison while young are present.
The horn on a male Nidoran’s forehead contains\na powerful poison. This is a very cautious\nPokémon, always straining its large ears.
Small but brave, this Pokémon will hold its\nground and even risk its life in battle to protect\nthe female it’s friendly with.
With a horn that’s harder than diamond, this\nPokémon goes around shattering boulders as it\nsearches for a moon stone.
It’s nervous and quick to act aggressively.\nThe potency of its poison increases along with\nthe level of adrenaline present in its body.
When it goes on a rampage, it’s impossible to\ncontrol. But in the presence of a Nidoqueen it’s\nlived with for a long time, Nidoking calms down.
Nidoking prides itself on its strength. It’s forceful\nand spirited in battle, making use of its thick tail\nand diamond-crushing horn.
It is said that happiness will come to those who\nsee a gathering of Clefairy dancing under a\nfull moon.
Its adorable behavior and cry make it highly popular.\nHowever, this cute Pokémon is rarely found.
A timid fairy Pokémon that is rarely seen, it will\nrun and hide the moment it senses people.
Their ears are sensitive enough to hear a pin\ndrop from over a mile away, so they’re usually\nfound in quiet places.
While young, it has six gorgeous tails. When it\ngrows, several new tails are sprouted.
As each tail grows, its fur becomes more lustrous.\nWhen held, it feels slightly warm.
It is said to live 1,000 years, and each of its tails\nis loaded with supernatural powers.
Very smart and very vengeful. Grabbing one of\nits many tails could result in a 1,000-year curse.
Jigglypuff has top-notch lung capacity, even by\ncomparison to other Pokémon. It won’t stop\nsinging its lullabies until its foes fall asleep.
By freely changing the wavelength of its voice,\nJigglypuff sings a mysterious melody sure to\nmake any listener sleepy.
The more air it takes in, the more it inflates. If\nopponents catch it in a bad mood, it will inflate\nitself to an enormous size to intimidate them.
It’s proud of its fur, which is fine and delicate.\nIn particular, the curl on its forehead has a\ntexture that’s perfectly heavenly.
It emits ultrasonic waves from its mouth to check\nits surroundings. Even in tight caves, Zubat flies\naround with skill.
Zubat live in caves, down where the sun’s light\nwon’t reach. In the morning, they gather together\nto keep each other warm as they sleep.
It loves to drink other creatures’ blood. It’s said\nthat if it finds others of its kind going hungry,\nit sometimes shares the blood it’s gathered.
Its feet are tiny, but this Pokémon walks skillfully.\nIt sneaks up on sleeping prey before sinking in its\nfangs and slurping up blood.
If exposed to moonlight, it starts to move.\nIt roams far and wide at night to scatter its seeds.
During the day, it stays in the cold underground\nto avoid the sun. It grows by bathing in moonlight.
Its pistils exude an incredibly foul odor.\nThe horrid stench can cause fainting at a distance\nof 1.25 miles.
What appears to be drool is actually sweet honey.\nIt is very sticky and clings stubbornly if touched.
It has the world’s largest petals. With every step,\nthe petals shake out heavy clouds of toxic pollen.
The larger its petals, the more toxic pollen it\ncontains. Its big head is heavy and hard to hold up.
If a Diglett digs through a field, it leaves the soil\nperfectly tilled and ideal for planting crops.
It burrows through the ground at a shallow depth.\nIt leaves raised earth in its wake, making it easy\nto spot.
A team of Diglett triplets. It triggers huge\nearthquakes by burrowing 60 miles underground.
These Diglett triplets dig over 60 miles below sea\nlevel. No one knows what it’s like underground.
It loves to collect shiny things. If it’s in a good\nmood, it might even let its Trainer have a look\nat its hoard of treasures.
It washes its face regularly to keep the coin on\nits forehead spotless. It doesn’t get along with\nGalarian Meowth.
Getting this prideful Pokémon to warm up to you\ntakes a lot of effort, and it will claw at you the\nmoment it gets annoyed.
Its elegant and refined behavior clashes with that\nof the barbaric Perrserker. The relationship\nbetween the two is one of mutual disdain.
Psyduck is constantly beset by headaches. If the\nPokémon lets its strange power erupt, apparently\nthe pain subsides for a while.
As Psyduck gets stressed out, its headache gets\nprogressively worse. It uses intense psychic\nenergy to overwhelm those around it.
This Pokémon lives in gently flowing rivers. It\npaddles through the water with its long limbs,\nputting its graceful swimming skills on display.
Old tales tell of Golduck punishing those that\ndefiled its river. The guilty were dragged into\nthe water and taken away.
It has a brave and trustworthy nature. It fearlessly\nstands up to bigger and stronger foes.
Extremely loyal, it will fearlessly bark at any\nopponent to protect its own Trainer from harm.
The sight of it running over 6,200 miles\nin a single day and night has captivated\nmany people.
A Pokémon that has long been admired for its\nbeauty. It runs agilely as if on wings.
For Poliwag, swimming is easier than walking.\nThe swirl pattern on its belly is actually part of\nthe Pokémon’s innards showing through the skin.
In rivers with fast-flowing water, this Pokémon will\ncling to a rock by using its thick lips, which act\nlike a suction cup.
Staring at the swirl on its belly causes drowsiness.\nThis trait of Poliwhirl’s has been used in place of\nlullabies to get children to go to sleep.
This Pokémon’s sweat is a slimy mucus. When\ncaptured, Poliwhirl can slither from its enemies’\ngrasp and escape.
Its body is solid muscle. When swimming through\ncold seas, Poliwrath uses its impressive arms to\nsmash through drift ice and plow forward.
Poliwrath is skilled at both swimming and martial\narts. It uses its well-trained arms to dish out\npowerful punches.
This Pokémon uses its psychic powers while it\nsleeps. The contents of Abra’s dreams affect the\npowers that the Pokémon wields.
Abra can teleport in its sleep. Apparently\nthe more deeply Abra sleeps, the farther its\nteleportations go.
Using its psychic power, Kadabra levitates as it\nsleeps. It uses its springy tail as a pillow.
This Pokémon’s telekinesis is immensely powerful.\nTo prepare for evolution, Kadabra stores up\npsychic energy in the star on its forehead.
It has an incredibly high level of intelligence.\nSome say that Alakazam remembers everything\nthat ever happens to it, from birth till death.
Alakazam wields potent psychic powers. It’s said\nthat this Pokémon used these powers to create\nthe spoons it holds.
Its whole body is composed of muscles.\nEven though it’s the size of a human child, it can\nhurl 100 grown-ups.
Always brimming with power, it passes time by\nlifting boulders. Doing so makes it even stronger.
Its muscular body is so powerful, it must wear a\npower-save belt to be able to regulate\nits motions.
Its formidable body never gets tired. It helps\npeople by doing work such as the moving of\nheavy goods.
It quickly swings its four arms to rock its\nopponents with ceaseless punches and chops\nfrom all angles.
With four arms that react more quickly than it\ncan think, it can execute many punches at once.
Tentacool is not a particularly strong swimmer.\nIt drifts across the surface of shallow seas as it\nsearches for prey.
This Pokémon is mostly made of water.\nA Tentacool out in the ocean is very hard to\nspot, because its body blends in with the sea.
When the red orbs on Tentacruel’s head glow\nbrightly, watch out. The Pokémon is about to\nfire off a burst of ultrasonic waves.
Its 80 tentacles can stretch and shrink freely.\nTentacruel ensnares prey in a net of spread-out\ntentacles, delivering venomous stings to its catch.
It can’t run properly when it’s newly born.\nAs it races around with others of its kind,\nits legs grow stronger.
If you’ve been accepted by Ponyta, its burning\nmane is mysteriously no longer hot to the touch.
This Pokémon can be seen galloping through\nfields at speeds of up to 150 mph, its fiery mane\nfluttering in the wind.
The fastest runner becomes the leader, and it\ndecides the herd’s pace and direction of travel.
Slow-witted and oblivious, this Pokémon won’t\nfeel any pain if its tail gets eaten. It won’t notice\nwhen its tail grows back, either.
When this Pokémon’s tail is soaked in water,\nsweetness seeps from it. Slowpoke uses this trait\nto lure in and fish up other Pokémon.
Slowpoke became Slowbro when a Shellder bit\non to its tail. Sweet flavors seeping from the tail\nmake the Shellder feel as if its life is a dream.
Being bitten by a Shellder shocked this Pokémon\ninto standing on two legs. If the Shellder lets go,\nit seems Slowbro will turn back into a Slowpoke.
At times, Magnemite runs out of electricity and\nends up on the ground. If you give batteries to a\ngrounded Magnemite, it’ll start moving again.
It subsists on electricity. As Magnemite flies, it\nemits electromagnetic waves from the units on\neach side of its body.
This Pokémon is three Magnemite that have\nlinked together. Magneton sends out powerful\nradio waves to study its surroundings.
This Pokémon is constantly putting out a powerful\nmagnetic force. Most computers go haywire when\na Magneton approaches.
The stalk this Pokémon carries in its wings serves\nas a sword to cut down opponents. In a dire\nsituation, the stalk can also serve as food.
They use a plant stalk as a weapon, but not all\nof them use it in the same way. Several distinct\nstyles of stalk fighting have been observed.
It swims facing backward by opening and closing\nits two-piece shell. It is surprisingly fast.
Its hard shell repels any kind of attack. It is\nvulnerable only when its shell is open.
Its shell is extremely hard. It cannot be shattered,\neven with a bomb. The shell opens only when it\nis attacking.
Once it slams its shell shut, it is impossible to\nopen, even by those with superior strength.
Born from gases, anyone would faint if engulfed\nby its gaseous body, which contains poison.
With its gas-like body, it can sneak into any place\nit desires. However, it can be blown away by wind.
Its tongue is made of gas. If licked, its victim\nstarts shaking constantly until death\neventually comes.
If you get the feeling of being watched in darkness\nwhen nobody is around, Haunter is there.
On the night of a full moon, if shadows move on\ntheir own and laugh, it must be Gengar’s doing.
It is said to emerge from darkness to steal the\nlives of those who become lost in mountains.
As it digs through the ground, it absorbs many\nhard objects. This is what makes its body so solid.
It rapidly bores through the ground at 50 mph by\nsquirming and twisting its massive, rugged body.
It can be found near the sea. The large pincers\ngrow back if they are torn out of their sockets.
If it senses danger approaching, it cloaks itself\nwith bubbles from its mouth so it will look bigger.
Its large and hard pincer has 10,000-horsepower\nstrength. However, being so big, it is unwieldy\nto move.
Its oversized claw is very powerful, but when it’s\nnot in battle, the claw just gets in the way.
Though it may look like it’s just a bunch of eggs,\nit’s a proper Pokémon. Exeggcute communicates\nwith others of its kind via telepathy, apparently.
These Pokémon get nervous when they’re not in a\ngroup of six. The minute even one member of the\ngroup goes missing, Exeggcute become cowardly.
Each of Exeggutor’s three heads is thinking\ndifferent thoughts. The three don’t seem to be\nvery interested in one another.
When they work together, Exeggutor’s three\nheads can put out powerful psychic energy.\nCloudy days make this Pokémon sluggish.
When the memory of its departed mother brings\nit to tears, its cries echo mournfully within the\nskull it wears on its head.
This Pokémon wears the skull of its deceased\nmother. Sometimes Cubone’s dreams make it cry,\nbut each tear Cubone sheds makes it stronger.
This Pokémon overcame its sorrow to evolve a\nsturdy new body. Marowak faces its opponents\nbravely, using a bone as a weapon.
When this Pokémon evolved, the skull of its\nmother fused to it. Marowak’s temperament also\nturned vicious at the same time.
This amazing Pokémon has an awesome sense of\nbalance. It can kick in succession from any position.
The legs freely contract and stretch. The stretchy\nlegs allow it to hit a distant foe with a rising kick.
Its punches slice the air. They are launched at\nsuch high speed, even a slight graze could cause\na burn.
Its punches slice the air. However, it seems to\nneed a short break after fighting for three minutes.
If this Pokémon’s sticky saliva gets on you and\nyou don’t clean it off, an intense itch will set in.\nThe itch won’t go away, either.
Bug Pokémon are Lickitung’s main food source.\nThis Pokémon paralyzes its prey with a lick from\nits long tongue, then swallows the prey whole.
Its body is full of poisonous gas. It floats into\ngarbage dumps, seeking out the fumes of raw,\nrotting trash.
It adores polluted air. Some claim that Koffing\nused to be more plentiful in the Galar region\nthan they are now.
It mixes gases between its two bodies.\nIt’s said that these Pokémon were seen\nall over the Galar region back in the day.
It can’t suck in air quite as well as a Galarian\nWeezing, but the toxins it creates are more\npotent than those of its counterpart.
Strong, but not too bright, this Pokémon can\nshatter even a skyscraper with its charging tackles.
It can remember only one thing at a time. Once it\nstarts rushing, it forgets why it started.
It begins walking on its hind legs after evolution.\nIt can punch holes through boulders with its horn.
Protected by an armor-like hide, it is capable of\nliving in molten lava of 3,600 degrees Fahrenheit.
The egg Chansey carries is not only delicious\nbut also packed with nutrition. It’s used as a\nhigh-class cooking ingredient.
This species was once very slow. To protect their\neggs from other creatures, these Pokémon\nbecame able to flee quickly.
Hidden beneath a tangle of vines that grows\nnonstop even if the vines are torn off, this\nPokémon’s true appearance remains a mystery.
The vines of a Tangela have a distinct scent.\nIn some parts of Galar, Tangela vines are used\nas herbs.
Although it’s carrying its baby in a pouch on\nits belly, Kangaskhan is swift on its feet. It\nintimidates its opponents with quick jabs.
There are records of a lost human child being\nraised by a childless Kangaskhan.
Horsea makes its home in oceans with gentle\ncurrents. If this Pokémon is under attack, it spits\nout pitch-black ink and escapes.
They swim with dance-like motions and cause\nwhirlpools to form. Horsea compete to see which\nof them can generate the biggest whirlpool.
It’s the males that raise the offspring. While\nSeadra are raising young, the spines on their\nbacks secrete thicker and stronger poison.
Seadra’s mouth is slender, but its suction power\nis strong. In an instant, Seadra can suck in food\nthat’s larger than the opening of its mouth.
Its dorsal, pectoral, and tail fins wave elegantly\nin water. That is why it is known as the Water Dancer.
Its dorsal and pectoral fins are strongly developed\nlike muscles. It can swim at a speed of five knots.
In autumn, its body becomes more fatty in\npreparing to propose to a mate. It takes on\nbeautiful colors.
Using its horn, it bores holes in riverbed\nboulders, making nests to prevent its eggs from\nwashing away.
If you visit a beach at the end of summer, you’ll\nbe able to see groups of Staryu lighting up in a\nsteady rhythm.
Fish Pokémon nibble at it, but Staryu isn’t\nbothered. Its body regenerates quickly, even\nif part of it is completely torn off.
This Pokémon has an organ known as its core.\nThe organ glows in seven colors when Starmie is\nunleashing its potent psychic powers.
Starmie swims by spinning its body at high speed.\nAs this Pokémon cruises through the ocean, it\nabsorbs tiny plankton.
The broadness of its hands may be no\ncoincidence—many scientists believe its palms\nbecame enlarged specifically for pantomiming.
It’s known for its top-notch pantomime skills.\nIt protects itself from all sorts of attacks by\nemitting auras from its fingers to create walls.
As Scyther fights more and more battles, its\nscythes become sharper and sharper. With a\nsingle slice, Scyther can fell a massive tree.
If you come across an area in a forest where a lot\nof the trees have been cut down, what you’ve\nfound is a Scyther’s territory.
In certain parts of Galar, Jynx was once feared\nand worshiped as the Queen of Ice.
The Jynx of Galar often have beautiful and\ndelicate voices. Some of these Pokémon have\neven gathered a fan base.
Many power plants keep Ground-type Pokémon\naround as a defense against Electabuzz that\ncome seeking electricity.
With the coming of a storm, many of these\nPokémon will gather under tall trees and sit there\nwaiting for lightning to strike.
Magmar dispatches its prey with fire. But it\nregrets this habit once it realizes that it has\nburned its intended prey to a charred crisp.
These Pokémon’s bodies are constantly burning.\nMagmar are feared as one of the causes\nbehind fires.
These Pokémon judge one another based on\npincers. Thicker, more impressive pincers make\nfor more popularity with the opposite gender.
This Pokémon clamps its pincers down on its prey\nand then either splits the prey in half or flings\nit away.
When Tauros begins whipping itself with its tails,\nit’s a warning that the Pokémon is about to\ncharge with astounding speed.
The Tauros of the Galar region are volatile in\nnature, and they won’t allow people to ride on\ntheir backs.
It is virtually worthless in terms of both power\nand speed. It is the most weak and pathetic\nPokémon in the world.
This weak and pathetic Pokémon gets easily\npushed along rivers when there are strong currents.
It has an extremely aggressive nature.\nThe Hyper Beam it shoots from its mouth\ntotally incinerates all targets.
Once it begins to rampage, a Gyarados will burn\neverything down, even in a harsh storm.
A smart and kindhearted Pokémon,\nit glides across the surface of the sea while\nits beautiful song echoes around it.
Crossing icy seas is no issue for this\ncold-resistant Pokémon. Its smooth skin\nis a little cool to the touch.
It can reconstitute its entire cellular\nstructure to change into what it sees,\nbut it returns to normal when it relaxes.
When it encounters another Ditto, it will move\nfaster than normal to duplicate that opponent exactly.
It has the ability to alter the composition of its\nbody to suit its surrounding environment.
Thanks to its unstable genetic makeup, this\nspecial Pokémon conceals many different\npossible evolutions.
When Vaporeon’s fins begin to vibrate, it is a\nsign that rain will come within a few hours.
Its body’s cellular structure is similar to the\nmolecular composition of water. It can melt\ninvisibly in water.
If it is angered or startled, the fur all over its\nbody bristles like sharp needles that pierce foes.
It accumulates negative ions in the atmosphere to\nblast out 10,000-volt lightning bolts.
Once it has stored up enough heat, this\nPokémon’s body temperature can reach up to\n1,700 degrees Fahrenheit.
It stores some of the air it inhales in its internal\nflame pouch, which heats it to over\n3,000 degrees Fahrenheit.
State-of-the-art technology was used to create\nPorygon. It was the first artificial Pokémon to be\ncreated via computer programming.
In recent years, this species has been very helpful\nin cyberspace. These Pokémon will go around\nchecking to make sure no suspicious data exists.
Because some Omanyte manage to escape after\nbeing restored or are released into the wild by\npeople, this species is becoming a problem.
This Pokémon is a member of an ancient, extinct\nspecies. Omanyte paddles through water with its\n10 tentacles, looking like it’s just drifting along.
Weighed down by a large and heavy shell,\nOmastar couldn’t move very fast. Some say it\nwent extinct because it was unable to catch food.
Omastar’s sharp fangs could crush rock, but the\nPokémon can attack only the prey that come\nwithin reach of its tentacles.
This species is almost entirely extinct. Kabuto\nmolt every three days, making their shells harder\nand harder.
While some say this species has gone extinct,\nKabuto sightings are apparently fairly common\nin some places.
Kabutops slices its prey apart and sucks out\nthe fluids. The discarded body parts become\nfood for other Pokémon.
The cause behind the extinction of this species is\nunknown. Kabutops were aggressive Pokémon\nthat inhabited warm seas.
This is a ferocious Pokémon from ancient times.\nApparently even modern technology is incapable\nof producing a perfectly restored specimen.
Aerodactyl’s sawlike fangs can shred skin to\ntatters—even the skin of Steel-type Pokémon.
It is not satisfied unless it eats over 880 pounds\nof food every day. When it is done eating, it\ngoes promptly to sleep.
This Pokémon’s stomach is so strong, even eating\nmoldy or rotten food will not affect it.
It’s said that this Pokémon’s beautiful blue wings\nare made of ice. Articuno flies over snowy\nmountains, its long tail fluttering along behind it.
This Pokémon can control ice at will. Articuno\nis said to live in snowy mountains riddled\nwith permafrost.
This Pokémon has complete control over\nelectricity. There are tales of Zapdos nesting in\nthe dark depths of pitch-black thunderclouds.
Zapdos is a legendary bird Pokémon. It’s said\nthat when Zapdos rubs its feathers together,\nlightning will fall immediately after.
It’s one of the legendary bird Pokémon. When\nMoltres flaps its flaming wings, they glimmer with\na dazzling red glow.
There are stories of this Pokémon using its\nradiant, flame-cloaked wings to light up paths\nfor those lost in the mountains.
Dratini dwells near bodies of rapidly flowing\nwater, such as the plunge pools of waterfalls.\nAs it grows, Dratini will shed its skin many times.
This Pokémon was long considered to be no\nmore than a myth. The small lump on a Dratini’s\nforehead is actually a horn that’s still coming in.
This Pokémon lives in pristine oceans and lakes.\nIt can control the weather, and it uses this power\nto fly into the sky, riding on the wind.
This Pokémon gathers power in the orbs on its\ntail and controls the weather. When enshrouded\nby an aura, Dragonair has a mystical appearance.
It’s a kindhearted Pokémon. If it spots a drowning\nperson or Pokémon, Dragonite simply must\nhelp them.
This Pokémon is known as the Sea Incarnate.\nFigureheads that resemble Dragonite decorate\nthe bows of many ships.
It always stands on one foot. It changes feet so\nfast, the movement can rarely be seen.
It begins to hoot at the same time every day.\nSome Trainers use them in place of clocks.
Its eyes are specially developed to enable it to\nsee clearly even in murky darkness and minimal light.
When it needs to think, it rotates its head\n180 degrees to sharpen its intellectual power.
Both of its legs have turned into wings. Without a\nsound, Crobat flies swiftly toward its prey and\nsinks its fangs into the nape of its target’s neck.
This Pokémon flaps its four wings skillfully.\nCrobat can fly through cramped caves without\nneeding to slow down.
Its antennae, which evolved from a fin, have both\npositive and negative charges flowing through them.
On the dark ocean floor, its only means of\ncommunication is its constantly flashing lights.
The light it emits is so bright that it can illuminate\nthe sea’s surface from a depth of over three miles.
This Pokémon flashes a bright light that blinds\nits prey. This creates an opening for it to deliver\nan electrical attack.
Despite its small size, it can zap even adult\nhumans. However, if it does so, it also\nsurprises itself.
The electric sacs in its cheeks are small. If even a\nlittle electricity leaks, it becomes shocked.
According to local rumors, Cleffa are often seen\nin places where shooting stars have fallen.
Because of its unusual, starlike silhouette, people\nbelieve that it came here on a meteor.
Igglybuff loves to sing. Its marshmallow-like body\ngives off a faint sweet smell.
Taking advantage of the softness of its body,\nIgglybuff moves as if bouncing. Its body turns a\ndeep pink when its temperature rises.
The shell seems to be filled with joy. It is said\nthat it will share good luck when treated kindly.
It is considered to be a symbol of good luck.\nIts shell is said to be filled with happiness.
They say that it will appear before kindhearted,\ncaring people and shower them with happiness.
It grows dispirited if it is not with kind people.\nIt can float in midair without moving its wings.
It is extremely good at climbing tree trunks and\nlikes to eat the new sprouts on the trees.
Because its wings aren’t yet fully grown, it has to\nhop to get around. It is always staring\nat something.
They say that it stays still and quiet because it is\nseeing both the past and future at the same time.
This odd Pokémon can see both the past and\nthe future. It eyes the sun’s movement all day.
Plentiful in the tropics. When it dances, its petals\nrub together and make a pleasant ringing sound.
Bellossom gather at times and appear to dance.\nThey say that the dance is a ritual to summon\nthe sun.
This Pokémon uses its round tail as a float. The\nball of Marill’s tail is filled with nutrients that\nhave been turned into an oil.
Even after Marill swims in a cold sea, its water-\nrepellent fur dries almost as soon as Marill leaves\nthe water. That’s why this Pokémon is never cold.
It spends most of its time in the water. On sunny\ndays, Azumarill floats on the surface of the water\nand sunbathes.
These Pokémon create air-filled bubbles. When\nAzurill play in rivers, Azumarill will cover them\nwith these bubbles.
If a tree branch shakes when there is no wind, it’s\na Sudowoodo, not a tree. It hides from the rain.
It disguises itself as a tree to avoid attack. It hates\nwater, so it will disappear if it starts raining.
At nightfall, these Pokémon appear on the shores\nof lakes. They announce their territorial claims by\nletting out cries that sound like shouting.
The cry of a male is louder than that of a female.\nMale Politoed with deep, menacing voices find\nmore popularity with the opposite gender.
This Pokémon lives in cold water. It will leave the\nwater to search for food when it gets cold outside.
When walking on land, it covers its body with a\npoisonous film that keeps its skin from dehydrating.
It has an easygoing nature. It doesn’t care if it\nbumps its head on boats and boulders\nwhile swimming.
Its body is always slimy. It often bangs its head\non the river bottom as it swims but seems not\nto care.
By reading air currents, it can predict things such\nas the weather or its foe’s next move.
It unleashes psychic power from the orb on its\nforehead. When its power is exhausted, the orb\ngrows dull and dark.
When this Pokémon becomes angry, its pores\nsecrete a poisonous sweat, which it sprays at\nits opponent’s eyes.
On the night of a full moon, or when it gets\nexcited, the ring patterns on its body glow yellow.
Miraculously, this former Slowpoke’s latent\nintelligence was drawn out when Shellder poison\nraced through its brain.
Slowking can solve any problem presented to it,\nbut no one can understand a thing Slowking says.
It hates light and shock. If attacked, it inflates its\nbody to pump up its counterstrike.
To keep its pitch-black tail hidden, it lives quietly\nin the darkness. It is never first to attack.
This Pokémon’s tiny wings have some scientists\nsaying that Dunsparce used to fly through the sky\nin ancient times.
The nests Dunsparce live in are mazes of tunnels.\nThey never get lost in their own nests—they can\ntell where they are by the scent of the dirt.
It is said that if an Onix lives for over 100 years,\nits composition changes to become diamond-like.
It is thought its body transformed as a result of\niron accumulating internally from swallowing soil.
When faced with a larger opponent, it swallows\nas much water as it can to match the\nopponent’s size.
The small spikes covering its body developed\nfrom scales. They inject a toxin that causes fainting.
Bulky pincers account for one third of Scizor’s\nbody weight. A single swing of one of these\npincers will crush a boulder completely.
Though its body is slim, Scizor has tremendous\nattacking power. Even Scizor’s muscles are made\nof metal.
It stores berries inside its shell. To avoid attacks,\nit hides beneath rocks and remains completely still.
The berries stored in its vaselike shell eventually\nbecome a thick, pulpy juice.
Heracross loves sweet sap and will go looking\nthrough forests for it. The Pokémon uses its two\nantennae to pick up scents as it searches.
This Pokémon takes pride in its strength, which\nallows it to lift things 100 times heavier than\nitself with no trouble at all.
Its paws conceal sharp claws. If attacked, it\nsuddenly extends the claws and startles\nits enemy.
It has a cunning yet savage disposition.\nIt waits for parents to leave their nests,\nand then it sneaks in to steal their eggs.
It rubs its snout on the ground to find and dig up\nfood. It sometimes discovers hot springs.
If it smells something enticing, it dashes off\nheadlong to find the source of the aroma.
If it charges at an enemy, the hairs on its back\nstand up straight. It is very sensitive to sound.
Although its legs are short, its rugged hooves\nprevent it from slipping, even on icy ground.
It will regrow any branches that break off its\nhead. People keep particularly beautiful Corsola\nbranches as charms to promote safe childbirth.
These Pokémon live in warm seas.\nIn prehistoric times, many lived in the\noceans around the Galar region as well.
The water they shoot from their mouths can hit\nmoving prey from more than 300 feet away.
Using its dorsal fin as a suction pad, it clings to a\nMantine’s underside to scavenge for leftovers.
It has a tendency to want to be in holes. It\nprefers rock crags or pots and sprays ink from\nthem before attacking.
It traps enemies with its suction-cupped\ntentacles, then smashes them with its\nrock-hard head.
It carries food all day long. There are tales about\nlost people who were saved by the food it had.
It has a generous habit of sharing its food with\npeople and Pokémon, so it’s always scrounging\naround for more food.
If it builds up enough speed swimming, it\ncan jump out above the waves and glide\nfor over 300 feet.
As it majestically swims, it doesn’t care if\nRemoraid attach to it to scavenge for its leftovers.
The pointed feathers of these Pokémon are\nsharper than swords. Skarmory and Corviknight\nfight viciously over territory.
People fashion swords from Skarmory’s shed\nfeathers, so this Pokémon is a popular element\nin heraldic designs.
With the arrival of a storm at sea, this Pokémon\nwill show itself on the surface. When a Kingdra\nand a Dragonite meet, a fierce battle ensues.
Scales shed by this Pokémon have such a\nsplendorous gleam to them that they’ve been\ngiven to royalty as gifts.
This is a Porygon that was updated with special\ndata. Porygon2 develops itself by learning about\nmany different subjects all on its own.
After artificial intelligence was implemented in\nPorygon2, the Pokémon began using a strange\nlanguage that only other Porygon2 understand.
It is always bursting with energy. To make itself\nstronger, it keeps on fighting even if it loses.
Even though it is small, it can’t be ignored because\nit will slug any handy target without warning.
It launches kicks while spinning. If it spins at high\nspeed, it may bore its way into the ground.
After doing a handstand to throw off the\nopponent’s timing, it presents its fancy kick moves.
If its face gets even slightly dirty, Smoochum will\nbathe immediately. But if its body gets dirty,\nSmoochum doesn’t really seem to care.
This is a very curious Pokémon. Smoochum\ndecides what it likes and dislikes by touching\nthings with its lips.
When a storm approaches, this Pokémon gets\nrestless. Once Elekid hears the sound of thunder,\nit gets full-on rowdy.
It’s not good at storing electricity yet. This\nPokémon sneaks into people’s homes, looking\nfor electrical outlets to eat electricity from.
This Pokémon is still small and timid.\nWhenever Magby gets excited or surprised,\nflames leak from its mouth and its nose.
This Pokémon makes its home near volcanoes.\nAt the end of the day, Magby soaks in magma,\nresting and recovering from the day’s fatigue.
Miltank produces highly nutritious milk, so it’s\nbeen supporting the lives of people and other\nPokémon since ancient times.
This Pokémon needs to be milked every day,\nor else it will fall ill. The flavor of Miltank milk\nchanges with the seasons.
Whenever a Blissey finds a weakened Pokémon,\nit will share its egg and offer its care until the\nother Pokémon is all better.
Blissey lays mysterious eggs that are filled with\nhappiness. It’s said that anyone who eats a\nBlissey egg will start acting kindly to all others.
Born deep underground, it comes\naboveground and becomes a pupa once it\nhas finished eating the surrounding soil.
It feeds on soil. After it has eaten a large\nmountain, it will fall asleep so it can grow.
Even sealed in its shell, it can move freely.\nHard and fast, it has outstanding\ndestructive power.
It will not stay still, even while it’s a pupa.\nIt already has arms and legs under its solid shell.
Its body can’t be harmed by any sort of attack,\nso it is very eager to make challenges\nagainst enemies.
The quakes caused when it walks make even\ngreat mountains crumble and change\nthe surrounding terrain.
This Pokémon has the ability to move through\ntime. Records describing it as a forest deity can\nbe found from many different eras.
This Pokémon traveled through time to come\nfrom the future. It bolsters grass and trees with\nits own strength, and it can heal wounds, too.
It marks its territory by rubbing its bristly fur on\ntrees. This variety of Zigzagoon is friendlier and\ncalmer than the kind native to Galar.
Zigzagoon that adapted to regions outside\nGalar acquired this appearance. If you’ve lost\nsomething, this Pokémon can likely find it.
Its fur is strong and supple. Shaving brushes\nmade with shed Linoone hairs are highly prized.
It uses its explosive speed and razor-sharp claws\nto bring down prey. Running along winding\npaths is not its strong suit.
It searches about for clean water. If it does not\ndrink water for too long, the leaf on its\nhead wilts.
Its leaf grew too large for it to live on land.\nThat is how it began to live floating in the water.
It is nocturnal and becomes active at nightfall.\nIt feeds on aquatic mosses that grow\nin the riverbed.
It lives at the water’s edge where it is sunny.\nIt sleeps on a bed of water grass by day and\nbecomes active at night.
The rhythm of bright, festive music activates\nLudicolo’s cells, making it more powerful.
If it hears festive music, it begins moving in\nrhythm in order to amplify its power.
If it remains still, it looks just like a real nut.\nIt delights in surprising foraging Pokémon.
It attaches itself to a tree branch using the top of\nits head. Strong winds can sometimes make it fall.
It lives deep in forests. With the leaf on its head,\nit makes a flute whose song makes listeners uneasy.
They live in holes bored in large trees. The sound\nof Nuzleaf’s grass flute fills listeners with dread.
A Pokémon that was feared as a forest guardian.\nIt can read the foe’s mind and take\npreemptive action.
It lives quietly in the deep forest. It is said to\ncreate chilly winter winds with the fans it holds.
It makes its nest on sheer cliffs. Riding the sea\nbreeze, it glides up into the expansive skies.
It soars on updrafts without flapping its wings.\nIt makes a nest on sheer cliffs at the sea’s edge.
It is a messenger of the skies, carrying small\nPokémon and eggs to safety in its bill.
Skimming the water’s surface, it dips its large bill\nin the sea, scoops up food and water, and\ncarries it.
It is highly attuned to the emotions of people\nand Pokémon. It hides if it senses hostility.
If its horns capture the warm feelings of people\nor Pokémon, its body warms up slightly.
If its Trainer becomes happy, it overflows with\nenergy, dancing joyously while spinning about.
It has a psychic power that enables it to distort\nthe space around it and see into the future.
It has the power to predict the future. Its power\npeaks when it is protecting its Trainer.
To protect its Trainer, it will expend all its psychic\npower to create a small black hole.
Because it lived almost entirely underground,\nit is nearly blind. It uses its antennae instead.
It can sometimes live underground for more than\n10 years. It absorbs nutrients from the roots\nof trees.
Its cry leaves a lasting headache if heard for too\nlong. It moves so quickly that it is almost invisible.
This Pokémon is so quick, it is said to be able to\navoid any attack. It loves to feed on tree sap.
A most peculiar Pokémon that somehow appears\nin a Poké Ball when a Nincada evolves.
A strange Pokémon—it flies without moving its\nwings, has a hollow shell for a body, and does\nnot breathe.
The cry of a Whismur is over 100 decibels.\nIf you’re close to a Whismur when it lets out a\ncry, you’ll be stuck with an all-day headache.
When Whismur cries, the sound of its own voice\nstartles it, making the Pokémon cry even louder.\nIt cries until it’s exhausted, then it falls asleep.
Loudred’s ears serve as speakers, and they can\nput out sound waves powerful enough to blow\naway a house.
The force of this Pokémon’s loud voice isn’t just\nthe sound—it’s also the wave of air pressure that\nblows opponents away and damages them.
In the past, people would use the loud voices of\nthese Pokémon as a means of communication\nbetween distant cities.
This Pokémon can do more than just shout. To\ncommunicate with others of its kind, it’ll emit all\nsorts of sounds from the holes in its body.
The ball on Azurill’s tail bounces like a rubber\nball, and it’s full of the nutrients the Pokémon\nneeds to grow.
Although Azurill are normally docile, an angry\none will swing around the big ball on its tail and\ntry to smash its opponents.
This Pokémon is feared. When its gemstone eyes\nbegin to glow with a sinister shine, it’s believed\nthat Sableye will steal people’s spirits away.
It feeds on gemstone crystals. In darkness, its\neyes sparkle with the glitter of jewels.
It uses its docile-looking face to lull foes into\ncomplacency, then bites with its huge,\nrelentless jaws.
It chomps with its gaping mouth. Its huge jaws are\nactually steel horns that have been transformed.
It eats iron ore—and sometimes railroad tracks—\nto build up the steel armor that protects its body.
When Aron evolves, its steel armor peels off. In\nancient times, people would collect Aron’s shed\narmor and make good use of it in their daily lives.
Lairon live in mountains brimming with spring\nwater and iron ore, so these Pokémon often\ncame into conflict with humans in the past.
During territorial disputes, Lairon fight by\nslamming into each other. Close inspection of\ntheir steel armor reveals scratches and dents.
Aggron has a horn sharp enough to perforate\nthick iron sheets. It brings down its opponents by\nramming into them horn first.
Long ago, there was a king who wore a helmet\nmeant to resemble the head of an Aggron. He\nwas trying to channel the Pokémon’s strength.
It stores static electricity in its fur for discharging.\nIt gives off sparks if a storm approaches.
It stores electricity in its fur. It gives off sparks\nfrom all over its body in seasons when the air is dry.
It stimulates its own muscles with electricity, so\nit can move quickly. It eases its soreness with\nelectricity, too, so it can recover quickly as well.
It rarely appears before people. It is said to nest\nwhere lightning has fallen.
Its flowers give off a relaxing fragrance.\nThe stronger its aroma, the healthier\nthe Roselia is.
It uses the different poisons in each hand\nseparately when it attacks. The stronger its\naroma, the healthier it is.
It won’t attack while it’s alone—not even if it\nspots prey. Instead, it waits for other Carvanha to\njoin it, and then the Pokémon attack as a group.
These Pokémon have sharp fangs and powerful\njaws. Sailors avoid Carvanha dens at all costs.
As soon as it catches the scent of prey, Sharpedo\nwill jet seawater from its backside, hurtling\ntoward the target to attack at 75 mph.
This Pokémon is known as the Bully of the Sea.\nAny ship entering the waters Sharpedo calls\nhome will be attacked—no exceptions.
It shows off by spraying jets of seawater from\nthe nostrils above its eyes. It eats a solid ton of\nWishiwashi every day.
When it sucks in a large volume of seawater,\nit becomes like a big, bouncy ball. It eats a ton\nof food daily.
It can sometimes knock out opponents\nwith the shock created by breaching and\ncrashing its big body onto the water.
Its immense size is the reason for its popularity.\nWailord watching is a favorite sightseeing\nactivity in various parts of the world.
It burns coal inside its shell for energy. It blows\nout black soot if it is endangered.
You find abandoned coal mines full of them.\nThey dig tirelessly in search of coal.
Its nest is a sloped, bowl-like pit in the desert.\nOnce something has fallen in, there is no escape.
It makes an inescapable conical pit and lies in\nwait at the bottom for prey to come\ntumbling down.
The ultrasonic waves it generates by rubbing its\ntwo wings together cause severe headaches.
To help make its wings grow, it dissolves\nquantities of prey in its digestive juices and\nguzzles them down every day.
This Pokémon hides in the heart of sandstorms\nit creates and seldom appears where people\ncan see it.
It is nicknamed the Desert Spirit because the\nflapping of its wings sounds like a woman singing.
Its cottony wings are full of air, making them light\nand fluffy to the touch. Swablu takes diligent care\nof its wings.
Since Swablu looks like a cumulus cloud, foes can\nhave a hard time finding it. Apparently its wings\nturned white over many generations.
As it flies in a calm and relaxed manner, Altaria\nperforms a humming song that would enrapture\nany audience.
This Pokémon has a kind disposition, but if it’s\nprovoked, it will threaten opponents with shrill\ncries before attacking them without mercy.
The phase of the moon apparently has some\neffect on its power. It’s active on the night of\na full moon.
It was discovered at the site of a meteor strike\n40 years ago. Its stare can lull its foes to sleep.
When it rotates itself, it gives off light similar to\nthe sun, thus blinding its foes.
Solar energy is the source of its power, so it is\nstrong during the daytime. When it spins, its\nbody shines.
Its slimy body is hard to grasp. In one region, it is\nsaid to have been born from hardened mud.
It probes muddy riverbeds with its two long\nwhiskers. A slimy film protects its body.
It makes its nest at the bottom of swamps. It will\neat anything—if it is alive, Whiscash will eat it.
It claims a large swamp to itself. If a foe comes\nnear it, it sets off tremors by thrashing around.
No matter how dirty the water in the river, it will\nadapt and thrive. It has a strong will to survive.
It was originally a Pokémon from afar that escaped\nto the wild. It can adapt to the dirtiest river.
A rough customer that wildly flails its giant claws.\nIt is said to be extremely hard to raise.
A brutish Pokémon that loves to battle. It will\ncrash itself into any foe that approaches its nest.
It moves while spinning around on its single foot.\nSome Baltoy have been seen spinning on\ntheir heads.
It was discovered in ancient ruins. While moving,\nit constantly spins. It stands on one foot even\nwhen asleep.
This mysterious Pokémon started life as an ancient\nclay figurine made over 20,000 years ago.
It appears to have been born from clay dolls\nmade by ancient people. It uses telekinesis to\nfloat and move.
This Pokémon was restored from a fossil.\nLileep once lived in warm seas that existed\napproximately 100,000,000 years ago.
Lileep clings to rocks on the seabed. When prey\ncomes close, this Pokémon entangles it with\npetallike tentacles.
It has short legs and can’t walk very fast, but its\nneck and tentacles can extend to over three\ntimes their usual length to nab distant prey.
Once Cradily catches prey in its tentacles,\nit digests them whole and absorbs their nutrients.
This Pokémon was restored from a fossil.\nAnorith lived in the ocean about 100,000,000\nyears ago, hunting with its pair of claws.
Anorith can swim swiftly by pulling its eight wings\nthrough the water like oars on a boat. This\nPokémon is an ancestor of modern bug Pokémon.
After evolution, this Pokémon emerged onto\nland. Its lower body has become stronger, and\nblows from its tail are devastating.
Though it lives on land, it’s also a good swimmer.\nIt dives into the ocean in search of prey, using its\nsharp claws to take down its quarry.
Although unattractive and unpopular, this\nPokémon’s marvelous vitality has made it a\nsubject of research.
It is a shabby and ugly Pokémon. However, it is\nvery hardy and can survive on little water.
Milotic has provided inspiration to many artists.\nIt has even been referred to as the most\nbeautiful Pokémon of all.
It’s said that a glimpse of a Milotic and its beauty\nwill calm any hostile emotions you’re feeling.
If it finds bad children who won’t listen to their\nparents, it will spirit them away—or so it’s said.
Making itself invisible, it silently sneaks up to\nprey. It has the ability to slip through thick walls.
Its body is entirely hollow. When it opens its\nmouth, it sucks everything in as if it were a\nblack hole.
It seeks drifting will-o’-the-wisps and sucks them\ninto its empty body. What happens inside is\na mystery.
Swift as the wind, Absol races through fields and\nmountains. Its curved, bow-like horn is acutely\nsensitive to the warning signs of natural disasters.
Because of this Pokémon’s ability to detect\ndanger, people mistook Absol as a bringer\nof doom.
It tends to move in a pack. Individuals squash\nagainst one another to toughen their spirits.
It tends to move in a pack with others.\nThey cluster in a tight group to sleep in a cave.
It’s said that if they are seen at midnight, they’ll\ncause heavy snow. They eat snow and ice\nto survive.
It can only survive in cold areas. It bounces\nhappily around, even in environments as cold as\n−150 degrees Fahrenheit.
It has a body of ice that won’t melt, even with\nfire. It can instantly freeze moisture in\nthe atmosphere.
It can instantly freeze moisture in the\natmosphere. It uses this power to freeze its foes.
This Pokémon’s body is covered in blubber and\nimpressively round. It’s faster for Spheal to roll\naround than walk.
As it drifts among the waves, Spheal probes\nthe sea. As soon as it spots prey, it informs the\nWalrein in its herd.
Sealeo live on top of drift ice. They go swimming\nwhen they’re on the hunt, seeking out their prey\nby scent.
This Pokémon has a habit of spinning round\nthings on its nose, whether those things are\nPoké Balls or Spheal.
Walrein form herds of 20 to 30 individuals.\nWhen a threat appears, the herd’s leader will\nprotect the group with its life.
Walrein’s tusks keep growing throughout its life.\nTusks broken in battle will grow back to their\nusual impressive size in a year.
Rock-hard scales and oil-filled swim bladders\nallow this Pokémon to survive the intense water\npressure of the deep sea.
This Pokémon was discovered during deep-sea\nexploration. Its appearance hasn’t changed in\n100,000,000 years, so it’s called a living fossil.
Bagon jumps off cliffs every day, trying to\ngrow stronger so that someday it will be able\nto fly.
Bagon is a solitary Pokémon that doesn’t form\ngroups with others of its kind. It also has a head\nhard enough to cleave a boulder in one strike.
This Pokémon has covered its body in a hard\nshell that has the same composition as bone.\nShelgon stores energy for evolution.
Shelgon ignores its hunger entirely, never eating\nany food. Apparently, Shelgon will evolve once\nall its energy stores are used up.
Salamence is an unusual Pokémon in that it\nwas able to evolve a body with wings just by\nconstantly wishing to be able to fly.
While basking in the joy of flight generally keeps\nthis Pokémon in high spirits, Salamence turns into\nan uncontrollable menace if something angers it.
From its rear, Beldum emits a magnetic force that\nrapidly pulls opponents in. They get skewered on\nBeldum’s sharp claws.
The cells in this Pokémon’s body are composed\nof magnetic material. Instead of blood, magnetic\nforces flow through Beldum’s body.
Two Beldum have become stuck together via\ntheir own magnetic forces. With two brains, the\nresulting Metang has doubled psychic powers.
Using magnetic forces to stay aloft, this Pokémon\nflies at high speeds, weaving through harsh\nmountain terrain in pursuit of prey.
Because the magnetic powers of these Pokémon\nget stronger in freezing temperatures, Metagross\nliving on snowy mountains are full of energy.
Metagross is the result of the fusion of two\nMetang. This Pokémon defeats its opponents\nthrough use of its supercomputer-level brain.
Every bit of Regirock’s body is made of stone.\nAs parts of its body erode, this Pokémon sticks\nrocks to itself to repair what’s been lost.
Cutting-edge technology was used to study\nthe internals of this Pokémon’s rock body, but\nnothing was found—not even a brain or a heart.
With cold air that can reach temperatures as low\nas −328 degrees Fahrenheit, Regice instantly\nfreezes any creature that approaches it.
This Pokémon’s body is made of solid ice. It’s\nsaid that Regice was born beneath thick ice in\nthe ice age.
Registeel’s body is made of a strange material\nthat is flexible enough to stretch and shrink but\nalso more durable than any metal.
It’s rumored that this Pokémon was born deep\nunderground in the planet’s mantle and that it\nemerged onto the surface 10,000 years ago.
Once every 1,000 years, the singing of a pure\nvoice will rouse this Pokémon from its near-\nperpetual slumber. It wakes for only seven days.
It’s believed that when this Pokémon wakes from\nits 1,000-year slumber, it will grant any wishes\nwritten on the notes attached to its head.
This Pokémon generates electricity by contracting\nits muscles. Excited trembling is a sign that Shinx\nis generating a tremendous amount of electricity.
Electricity makes this Pokémon’s fur glow. Shinx\nsends signals to others of its kind by shaking the\ntip of its tail while the tail tip is shining brightly.
By joining its tail with that of another Luxio, this\nPokémon can receive some of the other Luxio’s\nelectricity and power up its own electric blasts.
Upon encountering an opponent, this Pokémon\nprepares for battle by extending its claws, which\ncan put out 1,000,000 volts of electricity.
Luxray can see through solid objects. It will\ninstantly spot prey trying to hide behind walls,\neven if the walls are thick.
Seeing through solid objects uses up a lot of\nLuxray’s electricity, so the Pokémon sleeps for\nlong periods of time to store up energy.
The pollen it releases contains poison. If this\nPokémon is raised on clean water, the poison’s\ntoxicity is increased.
This Pokémon is highly sensitive to temperature\nchanges. When its bud starts to open, that means\nspring is right around the corner.
After captivating opponents with its sweet scent,\nit lashes them with its thorny whips.
The poison in its right hand is quick acting.\nThe poison in its left hand is slow acting.\nBoth are life threatening.
The members of the trio spend all their time\ntogether. Each one has a slightly different taste\nin nectar.
It ceaselessly gathers nectar from sunrise to\nsundown, all for the sake of Vespiquen and\nthe swarm.
It skillfully commands its grubs in battles with its\nenemies. The grubs are willing to risk their lives\nto defend Vespiquen.
Vespiquen that give off more pheromones\nhave larger swarms of Combee attendants.
It nimbly dashes about to avoid getting pecked\nby bird Pokémon that would love to make off\nwith its small, nutrient-rich storage ball.
The deeper a Cherubi’s red, the more nutrients it\nhas stockpiled in its body. And the sweeter and\ntastier its small ball!
As a bud, it barely moves. It sits still, placidly\nwaiting for sunlight to appear.
Its folded petals are pretty tough. Bird Pokémon\ncan peck at them all they want, and Cherrim\nwon’t be bothered at all.
This Pokémon’s habitat shapes its physique.\nAccording to some theories, life in warm ocean\nwaters causes this variation to develop.
Subjecting this Pokémon to a strong force\ncauses it to secrete a strange purple fluid.\nThough harmless, the fluid is awfully sticky.
Its search for food sometimes leads it onto land,\nwhere it leaves behind a sticky trail of slime as it\npasses through.
The softness of its body helps disperse the force\nof impacts, so although its body is uncommonly\nsquishy, it’s also surprisingly resilient.
Perhaps seeking company, it approaches children.\nHowever, it often quickly runs away again when\nthe children play too roughly with it.
The gathering of many souls gave rise to this\nPokémon. During humid seasons, they seem to\nappear in abundance.
Some say this Pokémon is a collection of souls\nburdened with regrets, silently drifting through\nthe dusk.
It grabs people and Pokémon and carries them\noff somewhere. Where do they go?\nNobody knows.
If both of Buneary’s ears are rolled up, something\nis wrong with its body or mind. It’s a sure sign the\nPokémon is in need of care.
Buneary can attack by rolling up their ears and\nthen striking with the force created by unrolling\nthem. This attack becomes stronger with training.
Lopunny is constantly monitoring its surroundings.\nIf danger approaches, this Pokémon responds\nwith superdestructive kicks.
Once hot seasons are over, Lopunny’s coat will\nbe replaced with fur that holds a lot of insulating\nair in preparation for colder weather.
From its rear, it sprays a foul-smelling liquid at\nopponents. It aims for their faces, and it can hit\nthem from over 16 feet away.
If it lifts its tail and points its rear at you, beware.\nIt’s about to spray you with a fluid stinky enough\nto make you faint.
In its belly, it reserves stinky fluid that it shoots\nfrom its tail during battle. As this Pokémon’s diet\nvaries, so does the stench of its fluid.
It digs holes in the ground to make its nest.\nThe stench of the fluid it lets fly from the tip\nof its tail is extremely potent.
It appears in ancient ruins. The pattern on its\nbody doesn’t come from any culture in the\nGalar region, so it remains shrouded in mystery.
Polishing Bronzor to a shine makes its surface\nreflect the truth, according to common lore.\nBe that as it may, Bronzor hates being polished.
Some believe it to be a deity that summons rain\nclouds. When angered, it lets out a warning cry\nthat rings out like the tolling of a bell.
Many scientists suspect that this Pokémon\noriginated outside the Galar region, based on\nthe patterns on its body.
It expels both sweat and tears from its eyes.\nThe sweat is a little salty, while the tears have\na slight bitterness.
This Pokémon lives in dry, rocky areas. As its\ngreen spheres dry out, their dull luster increases.
It mimics everyone it sees, but it puts extra\neffort into copying the graceful dance steps\nof Mr. Rime as practice.
It looks for a Mr. Rime that’s a good dancer\nand carefully copies the Mr. Rime’s steps\nlike an apprentice.
Mimicking Chansey, Happiny will place an egg-\nshaped stone in its belly pouch. Happiny will\ntreasure this stone.
Happiny’s willing to lend its precious round stone\nto those it’s friendly with, but if the stone isn’t\nreturned, Happiny will cry and throw a tantrum.
Exactly 108 spirits gathered to become this\nPokémon. Apparently there are some ill-natured\nspirits in the mix.
All Spiritomb’s mischief and misdeeds compelled\na traveler to use a mysterious spell to bind\nSpiritomb to an odd keystone.
Gible prefers to stay in narrow holes in the sides\nof caves heated by geothermal energy. This way,\nGible can stay warm even during a blizzard.
Gible attacks anything that moves, and it drags\nwhatever it catches into the crevice that is its lair.\nDespite the big mouth, Gible’s stomach is small.
This Pokémon emits ultrasonic waves from a\nprotrusion on either side of its head to probe\npitch-dark caves.
Jewels are buried in the caves these Pokémon\nnest in, but you’ll be torn apart by claws and\nfangs the moment you enter one of these caves.
Garchomp makes its home in volcanic mountains.\nIt flies through the sky as fast as a jet airplane,\nhunting down as much prey as it can.
Garchomp is fast both underground and above.\nIt can bring down prey and return to its den\nbefore its body has chilled from being outside.
Stuffing itself with vast amounts of food is its\nonly concern. Whether the food is rotten or\nfresh, yummy or tasteless—it does not care.
It stores food beneath its fur. It might share\njust one bite, but only if it really trusts you.
It’s exceedingly energetic, with enough stamina\nto keep running all through the night. Taking it\nfor walks can be a challenging experience.
It can use waves called auras to gauge how\nothers are feeling. These same waves can also tell\nthis Pokémon about the state of the environment.
It controls waves known as auras, which are\npowerful enough to pulverize huge rocks.\nIt uses these waves to take down its prey.
It can tell what people are thinking. Only Trainers\nwho have justice in their hearts can earn this\nPokémon’s trust.
It moves through the sands with its mouth open,\nswallowing sand along with its prey. It gets rid of\nthe sand by spouting it from its nose.
This Pokémon is active during the day and passes\nthe cold desert nights burrowed snugly into\nthe sand.
Stones can get stuck in the ports on their bodies.\nDwebble help dislodge such stones, so\nHippowdon look after these Pokémon.
When roused to violence by its rage, it spews out\nthe quantities of sand it has swallowed and\nwhips up a sandstorm.
After burrowing into the sand, it waits patiently\nfor prey to come near. This Pokémon and\nSizzlipede share common descent.
It attacks using the claws on its tail. Once locked\nin its grip, its prey is unable to move as this\nPokémon’s poison seeps in.
Its poison is potent, but it rarely sees use. This\nPokémon prefers to use physical force instead,\ngoing on rampages with its car-crushing strength.
It’s so vicious that it’s called the Sand Demon.\nYet when confronted by Hippowdon, Drapion\nkeeps a low profile and will never pick a fight.
It makes frightening noises with its poison-filled\ncheek sacs. When opponents flinch, Croagunk\nhits them with a poison jab.
Once diluted, its poison becomes medicinal.\nThis Pokémon came into popularity after a\npharmaceutical company chose it as a mascot.
It bounces toward opponents and gouges them\nwith poisonous claws. No more than a scratch\nis needed to knock out its adversaries.
It booms out a victory croak when its prey\ngoes down in defeat. This Pokémon and\nSeismitoad are related species.
Mantyke living in Galar seem to be somewhat\nsluggish. The colder waters of the seas in this\nregion may be the cause.
It swims along with a school of Remoraid, and\nthey’ll all fight together to repel attackers.
It lives on snowy mountains. It sinks its legs into\nthe snow to absorb water and keep its own\ntemperature down.
The berries that grow around its belly are like\nice pops. Galarian Darumaka absolutely love\nthese berries.
If it sees any packs of Darumaka going after\nSnover, it chases them off, swinging its sizable\narms like hammers.
This Pokémon is known to bring blizzards.\nA shake of its massive body is enough to\ncause whiteout conditions.
They attack their quarry in packs. Prey as large\nas Mamoswine easily fall to the teamwork of\na group of Weavile.
With its claws, it leaves behind signs for its\nfriends to find. The number of distinct signs\nis said to be over 500.
Some say that Magnezone receives signals from\nspace via the antenna on its head and that it’s\nbeing controlled by some mysterious being.
It’s thought that a special magnetic field changed\nthe molecular structure of this Pokémon’s body,\nand that’s what caused the Pokémon’s evolution.
Lickilicky’s strange tongue can stretch to many\ntimes the length of its body. No one has figured\nout how Lickilicky’s tongue can stretch so far.
Lickilicky can do just about anything with its\ntongue, which is as dexterous as the human hand.\nIn contrast, Lickilicky’s use of its fingers is clumsy.
It can load up to three projectiles per arm into\nthe holes in its hands. What launches out of those\nholes could be either rocks or Roggenrola.
It relies on its carapace to deflect incoming\nattacks and throw its enemy off balance. As soon\nas that happens, it drives its drill into the foe.
Tangrowth has two arms that it can extend as it\npleases. Recent research has shown that these\narms are, in fact, bundles of vines.
Vine growth is accelerated for Tangrowth living in\nwarm climates. If the vines grow long, Tangrowth\nshortens them by tearing parts of them off.
The amount of electrical energy this Pokémon\nproduces is proportional to the rate of its pulse.\nThe voltage jumps while Electivire is battling.
In terms of electrical-energy output, Electivire\nis one of the best among all Electric Pokémon.\nIt discharges high-voltage currents from its tails.
When Magmortar inhales deeply, the fire burning\nin its belly intensifies, rising in temperature to\nover 3,600 degrees Fahrenheit.
Living in the crater of a volcano has caused this\nPokémon’s body to resemble its environment—\nit has an organ similar to a magma chamber.
These Pokémon are never seen anywhere near\nconflict or turmoil. In recent times, they’ve hardly\nbeen seen at all.
Known as a bringer of blessings, it’s\nbeen depicted on good-luck charms\nsince ancient times.
Galarians favor the distinctive aroma that drifts\nfrom this Pokémon’s leaves. There’s a popular\nperfume made using that scent.
This Pokémon’s tail is blade sharp, with a\nfantastic cutting edge that can slice right\nthough large trees.
Any who become captivated by the beauty of\nthe snowfall that Glaceon creates will be frozen\nbefore they know it.
The coldness emanating from Glaceon causes\npowdery snow to form, making it quite a popular\nPokémon at ski resorts.
This Pokémon can be spotted in wall paintings\nfrom as far back as 10,000 years ago. For a\nwhile, it was thought to have gone extinct.
It looks strong, and that’s exactly what it is.\nAs the weather grows colder, its ice tusks\ngrow longer, thicker, and more impressive.
Porygon-Z had a program installed to allow it to\nmove between dimensions, but the program also\ncaused instability in Porygon-Z’s behavior.
Some say an additional program made this\nPokémon evolve, but even academics can’t agree\non whether Porygon-Z is really an evolution.
True to its honorable-warrior image, it uses\nthe blades on its elbows only in defense of\nsomething or someone.
Sharply attuned to others’ wishes for help, this\nPokémon seeks out those in need and aids them\nin battle.
At the bidding of transmissions from the spirit\nworld, it steals people and Pokémon away.\nNo one knows whether it has a will of its own.
With the mouth on its belly, Dusknoir swallows its\ntarget whole. The soul is the only thing eaten—\nDusknoir disgorges the body before departing.
After a woman met her end on a snowy mountain,\nher regrets lingered on. From them, this Pokémon\nwas born. Its favorite food is frozen souls.
It spits out cold air of nearly −60 degrees\nFahrenheit to freeze its quarry. It brings frozen\nprey back to its lair and neatly lines them up.
One boy’s invention led to the development of\nmany different machines that take advantage of\nRotom’s unique capabilities.
With a body made of plasma, it can inhabit all\nsorts of machines. It loves to surprise others.
All over the world, there are legends that tell\nof Regigigas creating other Pokémon in its\nown image.
It’s said that Regigigas created other Pokémon\nfrom many different materials before it moved\nthe continents to where they are today.
This Pokémon is courageous but also cautious.\nIt uses the soft fur covering its face to collect\ninformation about its surroundings.
This Pokémon is far brighter than the average\nchild, and Lillipup won’t forget the love it\nreceives or any abuse it suffers.
Herdier is a very smart and friendly Pokémon.\nSo much so that there’s a theory that Herdier was\nthe first Pokémon to partner with people.
The black fur that covers this Pokémon’s body\nis dense and springy. Even sharp fangs bounce\nright off.
These Pokémon seem to enjoy living with humans.\nEven a Stoutland caught in the wild will warm up\nto people in about three days.
Stoutland is immensely proud of its impressive\nmoustache. It’s said that moustache length is what\ndetermines social standing among this species.
It steals things from people just to amuse itself\nwith their frustration. A rivalry exists between\nthis Pokémon and Nickit.
Opponents that get drawn in by its adorable\nbehavior come away with stinging scratches from\nits claws and stinging pride from its laughter.
Don’t be fooled by its gorgeous fur and elegant\nfigure. This is a moody and vicious Pokémon.
This stealthy Pokémon sneaks up behind prey\nwithout making any sound at all. It competes with\nThievul for territory.
Late at night, it appears beside people’s pillows.\nAs it feeds on dreams, the patterns on its body\ngive off a faint glow.
It eats dreams and releases mist. The mist is pink\nwhen it’s eating a good dream, and black when\nit’s eating a nightmare.
When dark mists emanate from its body, don’t\nget too near. If you do, your nightmares will\nbecome reality.
It drowses and dreams all the time. It’s best to\nleave it be if it’s just woken up, as it’s a terrible\ngrump when freshly roused from sleep.
Where people go, these Pokémon follow.\nIf you’re scattering food for them, be careful—\nseveral hundred of them can gather at once.
It’s forgetful and not very bright, but many\nTrainers love it anyway for its friendliness\nand sincerity.
It can fly moderately quickly. No matter how far\nit travels, it can always find its way back to its\nmaster and its nest.
These bright Pokémon have acute memories.\nApparently delivery workers often choose them\nas their partners.
Unfezant are exceptional fliers. The females\nare known for their stamina, while the males\noutclass them in terms of speed.
Females of this species are very capable fliers,\nparticularly notable for their stamina. They also\ntake longer to adjust to people.
This Pokémon is intelligent and intensely proud.\nPeople will sit up and take notice if you become\nthe Trainer of one.
This Pokémon is intelligent and intensely proud.\nPeople will sit up and take notice if you become\nthe Trainer of one.
It’s as hard as steel, but apparently a long soak in\nwater will cause it to soften a bit.
When it detects a noise, it starts to move.\nThe energy core inside it makes this Pokémon\nslightly warm to the touch.
If you see its orange crystals start to glow, be\nwary. It’s about to fire off bursts of energy.
It relies on sound in order to monitor what’s in its\nvicinity. When angered, it will attack without ever\nchanging the direction it’s facing.
This hardy Pokémon can often be found on\nconstruction sites and in mines, working\nalongside people and Copperajah.
Although its energy blasts can blow away\na dump truck, they have a limitation—\nthey can only be fired when the sun is out.
While inside a cave, if you look up and see lots\nof heart-shaped marks lining the walls, it’s\nevidence that Woobat live there.
It emits ultrasonic waves as it flutters about,\nsearching for its prey—bug Pokémon.
Emitting powerful sound waves tires it out.\nAfterward, it won’t be able to fly for a\nlittle while.
The auspicious shape of this Pokémon’s nose\napparently led some regions to consider\nSwoobat a symbol of good luck.
It brings its claws together and whirls around at\nhigh speed before rushing toward its prey.
It’s a digger, using its claws to burrow through the\nground. It causes damage to vegetable crops, so\nmany farmers have little love for it.
It’s not uncommon for tunnels that appear to\nhave formed naturally to actually be a result\nof Excadrill’s rampant digging.
Known as the Drill King, this Pokémon can\ntunnel through the terrain at speeds of over\n90 mph.
Audino’s sense of hearing is superb. Not even a\npebble rolling along over a mile away will escape\nAudino’s ears.
This Pokémon has a kind heart. By touching with\nits feelers, Audino can gauge other creatures’\nfeelings and physical conditions.
It loves helping out with construction projects.\nIt loves it so much that if rain causes work to halt,\nit swings its log around and throws a tantrum.
Timburr that have started carrying logs that are\nabout three times their size are nearly ready\nto evolve.
It shows off its muscles to Machoke and other\nGurdurr. If it fails to measure up to the other\nPokémon, it lies low for a little while.
Gurdurr excels at demolition—construction is not\nits forte. In any case, there’s skill in the way this\nPokémon wields its metal beam.
Concrete mixed by Conkeldurr is much more\ndurable than normal concrete, even when the\ncompositions of the two materials are the same.
When going all out, this Pokémon throws aside\nits concrete pillars and leaps at opponents to\npummel them with its fists.
Graceful ripples running across the water’s\nsurface are a sure sign that Tympole are singing\nin high-pitched voices below.
It uses sound waves to communicate with\nothers of its kind. People and other Pokémon\nspecies can’t hear its cries of warning.
It weakens its prey with sound waves intense\nenough to cause headaches, then entangles\nthem with its sticky tongue.
On occasion, their cries are sublimely pleasing to\nthe ear. Palpitoad with larger lumps on their\nbodies can sing with a wider range of sounds.
The vibrating of the bumps all over its body\ncauses earthquake-like tremors. Seismitoad and\nCroagunk are similar species.
This Pokémon is popular among the elderly,\nwho say the vibrations of its lumps are great\nfor massages.
It performs throwing moves with first-rate skill.\nOver the course of many battles, Throh’s belt\ngrows darker as it absorbs its wearer’s sweat.
They train in groups of five. Any member that\ncan’t keep up will discard its belt and leave\nthe group.
If you see a Sawk training in the mountains in its\nsingle-minded pursuit of strength, it’s best to\nquietly pass by.
The karate chops of a Sawk that’s trained itself\nto the limit can cleave the ocean itself.
Venipede and Sizzlipede are similar species,\nbut when the two meet, a huge fight ensues.
Its fangs are highly venomous. If this Pokémon\nfinds prey it thinks it can eat, it leaps for them\nwithout any thought of how things might turn out.
This Pokémon spins itself rapidly and charges into\nits opponents. Its top speed is just over 60 mph.
Whirlipede protects itself with a sturdy shell and\npoisonous spikes while it stores up the energy it’ll\nneed for evolution.
Scolipede latches on to its prey with the claws on\nits neck before slamming them into the ground\nand jabbing them with its claws’ toxic spikes.
Scolipede engage in fierce territorial battles with\nCentiskorch. At the end of one of these battles,\nthe victor makes a meal of the loser.
It shoots cotton from its body to protect itself.\nIf it gets caught up in hurricane-strength winds,\nit can get sent to the other side of the Earth.
Weaving together the cotton of both Cottonee\nand Eldegoss produces exquisite cloth that’s\nhighly prized by many luxury brands.
It scatters cotton all over the place as a prank. If\nit gets wet, it’ll become too heavy to move and\nhave no choice but to answer for its mischief.
As long as this Pokémon bathes in sunlight, its\ncotton keeps growing. If too much cotton fluff\nbuilds up, Whimsicott tears it off and scatters it.
Petilil appears around sources of clean water.\nBoiling leaves from this Pokémon’s head results in\na liquid that’s sometimes used as a bug repellent.
The deeper the color of a Petilil’s leaves, the\nhealthier the Pokémon is. Petilil sometimes makes\nits home in a well-tended field or flowerbed.
It’s believed that even first-rate gardeners have a\nhard time getting the flower on a Lilligant’s head\nto bloom.
Essential oils made from Lilligant flowers\nhave a sublime scent, but they’re also\nstaggeringly expensive.
Anglers love the fight this Pokémon puts up on\nthe hook. And there are always more to catch—\nmany people release them into lakes illicitly.
In the past, it often appeared on the dinner\ntable. The meat of red-striped Basculin is on the\nfatty side, and it’s more popular with the youth.
The desert gets cold at night, so when the sun\nsets, this Pokémon burrows deep into the sand\nand sleeps until sunrise.
Sandile is small, but its legs and lower body are\npowerful. Pushing sand aside as it goes, Sandile\nmoves through the desert as if it’s swimming.
Krokorok has specialized eyes that enable it to\nsee in the dark. This ability lets Krokorok hunt in\nthe dead of night without getting lost.
Although this Pokémon has specialized eyes that\nallow it to see in the dark, Krokorok won’t move\nmuch at night—the desert gets cold after sunset.
This Pokémon is known as the Bully of the Sands.\nKrookodile’s mighty jaws can bite through heavy\nplates of iron with almost no effort at all.
While terribly aggressive, Krookodile also has\nthe patience to stay hidden under sand for days,\nlying in wait for prey.
It derives its power from fire burning inside\nits body. If the fire dwindles, this Pokémon will\nimmediately fall asleep.
