This popular symbol of good fortune will never\nfall over in its sleep, no matter how it’s pushed\nor pulled.
The thick arms of this hot-blooded Pokémon\ncan deliver punches capable of obliterating a\ndump truck.
This Pokémon’s power level rises along with the\ntemperature of its fire, which can reach 2,500\ndegrees Fahrenheit.
With noises that could be mistaken for the rattles\nof maracas, it creates an upbeat rhythm, startling\nbird Pokémon and making them fly off in a hurry.
Once each year, this Pokémon scatters its seeds.\nThey’re jam-packed with nutrients, making them\na precious food source out in the desert.
When it finds a stone appealing, it creates a hole\ninside it and uses it as its home. This Pokémon is\nthe natural enemy of Roggenrola and Rolycoly.
It first tries to find a rock to live in, but if there\nare no suitable rocks to be found, Dwebble may\nmove in to the ports of a Hippowdon.
This highly territorial Pokémon prefers dry\nclimates. It won’t come out of its boulder on\nrainy days.
Its thick claws are its greatest weapons.\nThey’re mighty enough to crack\nRhyperior’s carapace.
If it locks eyes with you, watch out! Nothing and\nno one is safe from the reckless headbutts of this\ntroublesome Pokémon.
It protects itself with its durable skin. It’s thought\nthat this Pokémon will evolve once its skin has\ncompletely stretched out.
As halfhearted as this Pokémon’s kicks may seem,\nthey pack enough power to shatter Conkeldurr’s\nconcrete pillars.
While mostly known for having the temperament\nof an aggressive ruffian, this Pokémon takes very\ngood care of its family, friends, and territory.
Psychic power allows these Pokémon to fly. Some\nsay they were the guardians of an ancient city.\nOthers say they were the guardians’ emissaries.
A discovery was made in the desert where\nSigilyph fly. The ruins of what may have been\nan ancient city were found beneath the sands.
It wanders through ruins by night, carrying a mask\nthat’s said to have been the face it had when it\nwas still human.
The spirit of a person from a bygone age became\nthis Pokémon. It rambles through ruins, searching\nfor someone who knows its face.
This Pokémon has a body of sparkling gold.\nPeople say it no longer remembers that it was\nonce human.
There are many depictions of Cofagrigus\ndecorating ancient tombs. They’re symbols\nof the wealth that kings of bygone eras had.
This Pokémon inhabited ancient seas. Although\nit can only crawl, it still comes up onto land in\nsearch of prey.
Tirtouga is considered to be the ancestor of\nmany turtle Pokémon. It was restored to life\nfrom a fossil.
Carracosta completely devours its prey—bones,\nshells, and all. Because of this, Carracosta’s own\nshell grows thick and sturdy.
This Pokémon emerges from the water in search\nof prey despite the fact that it moves more\nslowly on land.
This Pokémon was successfully restored from a\nfossil. As research suggested, Archen is unable\nto fly. But it’s very good at jumping.
Archen is said to be the ancestor of bird\nPokémon. It lived in treetops, eating berries\nand bug Pokémon.
It needs a running start to take off. If Archeops\nwants to fly, it first needs to run nearly 25 mph,\nbuilding speed over a course of about 2.5 miles.
Though capable of flight, Archeops was\napparently better at hunting on the ground.
Its favorite places are unsanitary ones. If you\nleave trash lying around, you could even find\none of these Pokémon living in your room.
This Pokémon was born from a bag stuffed with\ntrash. Galarian Weezing relish the fumes belched\nby Trubbish.
This Pokémon eats trash, which turns into poison\ninside its body. The main component of the\npoison depends on what sort of trash was eaten.
The toxic liquid it launches from its right arm\nis so virulent that it can kill a weakened\ncreature instantly.
Zorua is a timid Pokémon. This disposition seems\nto be what led to the development of Zorua’s\nability to take on the forms of other creatures.
Zorua sometimes transforms into a person and\ngoes into cities to search for food. When Zorua\ndoes this, it usually takes on the form of a child.
This Pokémon cares deeply about others of its\nkind, and it will conjure terrifying illusions to\nkeep its den and pack safe.
Seeking to ease the burden of their solitude,\nlonely Trainers tell Zoroark to show illusions\nto them.
The way it brushes away grime with its tail\ncan be helpful when cleaning. But its focus on\nspotlessness can make cleaning more of a hassle.
They pet each other with their tails as a form of\ngreeting. Of the two, the one whose tail is fluffier\nis a bit more boastful.
Its body secretes oil that this Pokémon spreads\nover its nest as a coating to protect it from dust.\nCinccino won’t tolerate even a speck of the stuff.
A special oil that seeps through their fur helps\nthem avoid attacks. The oil fetches a high price\nat market.
Though they’re still only babies, there’s psychic\npower stored in their ribbonlike feelers, and\nsometimes they use that power to fight.
Even when nobody seems to be around, Gothita\ncan still be heard making a muted cry. Many believe\nit’s speaking to something only it can see.
It’s said that when stars shine in the night sky,\nthis Pokémon will spirit away sleeping children.\nSome call it the Witch of Punishment.
On nights when the stars shine, this Pokémon’s\npsychic power is at its strongest. It’s unknown just\nwhat link Gothorita has to the greater universe.
It has tremendous psychic power, but it dislikes\nconflict. It’s also able to predict the future based\non the movement of the stars.
A criminal who was shown his fate by a Gothitelle\nwent missing that same day and was never\nseen again.
It communicates with others telepathically.\nIts body is encapsulated in liquid, but if it takes\na heavy blow, the liquid will leak out.
Many say that the special liquid covering this\nPokémon’s body would allow it to survive in\nthe vacuum of space.
Its psychic power can supposedly cover a range\nof more than half a mile—but only if its two\nbrains can agree with each other.
Its brain has split into two, and the two\nhalves rarely think alike. Its actions are\nutterly unpredictable.
While it could use its psychic abilities in battle,\nthis Pokémon prefers to swing its powerful arms\naround to beat opponents into submission.
It’s said that drinking the liquid surrounding\nReuniclus grants wisdom. Problem is, the liquid is\nhighly toxic to anything besides Reuniclus itself.
Unable to survive in hot areas, it makes itself\ncomfortable by breathing out air cold enough to\ncause snow. It burrows into the snow to sleep.
Supposedly, this Pokémon was born from an\nicicle. It spews out freezing air at −58 degrees\nFahrenheit to make itself more comfortable.
By drinking pure water, it grows its icy body.\nThis Pokémon can be hard to find on days with\nwarm, sunny weather.
It blasts enemies with cold air reaching −148\ndegrees Fahrenheit, freezing them solid. But it\nspares their lives afterward—it’s a kind Pokémon.
When its anger reaches a breaking point, this\nPokémon unleashes a fierce blizzard that freezes\nevery creature around it, be they friend or foe.
People believe this Pokémon formed when two\nVanillish stuck together. Its body temperature is\nroughly 21 degrees Fahrenheit.
As Emolga flutters through the air, it crackles\nwith electricity. This Pokémon is cute, but it can\ncause a lot of trouble.
This Pokémon absolutely loves sweet berries.\nSometimes it stuffs its cheeks full of so much\nfood that it can’t fly properly.
Its strange physiology reacts to electrical energy\nin interesting ways. The presence of a Shelmet\nwill cause this Pokémon to evolve.
It spits a liquid from its mouth to melt through\nShelmet’s shell. Karrablast doesn’t eat the shell—\nit eats only the contents.
They use shells they’ve stolen from Shelmet\nto arm and protect themselves. They’re very\npopular Pokémon in the Galar region.
It charges its enemies, lances at the ready.\nAn image of one of its duels is captured in a famous\npainting of Escavalier clashing with Sirfetch’d.
No one knows what the Poké Ball–like pattern on\nFoongus means or why Foongus has it.
The spores released from this Pokémon’s hands\nare highly poisonous, but when thoroughly dried,\nthe spores can be used as stomach medicine.
This Pokémon puffs poisonous spores at its foes.\nIf the spores aren’t washed off quickly, they’ll\ngrow into mushrooms wherever they land.
Amoonguss generally doesn’t move much. It\ntends to stand still near Poké Balls that have\nbeen dropped on the ground.
It envelops its prey in its veillike arms and draws\nit down to the deeps, five miles below the\nocean’s surface.
It envelops its prey in its veillike arms and draws\nit down to the deeps, five miles below the\nocean’s surface.
Legend has it that the residents of a sunken\nancient city changed into these Pokémon.
Its thin, veillike arms have tens of thousands\nof poisonous stingers. Females have slightly\nlonger stingers.
Most of this Pokémon’s body composition is\nidentical to sea water. It makes sunken ships\nits lair.
These Pokémon have body compositions\nthat are mostly identical to seawater.\nThey make their lairs from sunken ships.
Whenever a full moon hangs in the night sky,\nschools of Jellicent gather near the surface of\nthe sea, waiting for their prey to appear.
The crown on its head gets bigger and bigger\nas it absorbs more and more of the life-force\nof other creatures.
Joltik can be found clinging to other Pokémon.\nIt’s soaking up static electricity because it can’t\nproduce a charge on its own.
Joltik latch on to other Pokémon and suck out\nstatic electricity. They’re often found sticking to\nYamper’s hindquarters.
It launches electrified fur from its abdomen as its\nmeans of attack. Opponents hit by the fur could\nbe in for three full days and nights of paralysis.
It lays traps of electrified threads near the nests\nof bird Pokémon, aiming to snare chicks that are\nnot yet good at flying.
It defends itself by launching spikes, but its\naim isn’t very good at first. Only after a lot of\npractice will it improve.
Mossy caves are their preferred dwellings.\nEnzymes contained in mosses help Ferroseed’s\nspikes grow big and strong.
This Pokémon scrapes its spikes across rocks,\nand then uses the tips of its feelers to absorb\nthe nutrients it finds within the stone.
Its spikes are harder than steel. This Pokémon\ncrawls across rock walls by stabbing the spikes\non its feelers into the stone.
The two minigears that compose this Pokémon\nare closer than twins. They mesh well only with\neach other.
It’s suspected that Klink were the inspiration\nbehind ancient people’s invention of the\nfirst gears.
When Klang goes all out, the minigear links up\nperfectly with the outer part of the big gear, and\nthis Pokémon’s rotation speed increases sharply.
Many companies in the Galar region choose\nKlang as their logo. This Pokémon is considered\nthe symbol of industrial technology.
From its spikes, it launches powerful blasts of\nelectricity. Its red core contains an enormous\namount of energy.
The three gears that compose this Pokémon\nspin at high speed. Its new spiked gear isn’t\na living creature.
If this Pokémon stands near a TV, strange scenery\nwill appear on the screen. That scenery is said\nto be from its home.
This Pokémon was discovered about 50 years\nago. Its highly developed brain enables it to\nexert its psychic powers.
Whenever a Beheeyem visits a farm,\na Dubwool mysteriously disappears.
Sometimes found drifting above wheat fields,\nthis Pokémon can control the memories of\nits opponents.
The flame on its head keeps its body slightly\nwarm. This Pokémon takes lost children by the\nhand to guide them to the spirit world.
The younger the life this Pokémon absorbs,\nthe brighter and eerier the flame on its\nhead burns.
This Pokémon appears just before someone\npasses away, so it’s feared as an emissary\nof death.
It lurks in cities, pretending to be a lamp.\nOnce it finds someone whose death is near,\nit will trail quietly after them.
This Pokémon haunts dilapidated mansions.\nIt sways its arms to hypnotize opponents with\nthe ominous dancing of its flames.
In homes illuminated by Chandelure instead of\nlights, funerals were a constant occurrence—\nor so it’s said.
These Pokémon nest in the ground and use their\ntusks to crush hard berries. Crushing berries is\nalso how they test each other’s strength.
They play with each other by knocking their large\ntusks together. Their tusks break sometimes, but\nthey grow back so quickly that it isn’t a concern.
After battle, this Pokémon carefully sharpens its\ntusks on river rocks. It needs to take care of its\ntusks—if one breaks, it will never grow back.
Its skin is as hard as a suit of armor. Fraxure’s\nfavorite strategy is to tackle its opponents,\nstabbing them with its tusks at the same time.
Its resilient tusks are its pride and joy. It licks up\ndirt to take in the minerals it needs to keep its\ntusks in top condition.
While usually kindhearted, it can be terrifying if\nangered. Tusks that can slice through steel beams\nare how Haxorus deals with its adversaries.
When this Pokémon is in good health, its snot\nbecomes thicker and stickier. It will smear its snot\non anyone it doesn’t like.
It sniffles before performing a move, using its\nfrosty snot to provide an icy element to any\nmove that needs it.
It swims through frigid seas, searching for prey.\nFrom its frozen breath, it forms icy fangs that\nare harder than steel.
It swims energetically through frigid seas.\nWhen it gets tired, it freezes the seawater\nwith its breath so it can rest on the ice.
With its icy chains, Cryogonal freezes those it\nencounters. It then takes its victims away to\nsomewhere unknown.
When the weather gets hot, these Pokémon turn\ninto water vapor. Cryogonal are almost never\nseen during summer.
When attacked, it tightly shuts the lid of its shell.\nThis reaction fails to protect it from Karrablast,\nhowever, because they can still get into the shell.
It has a strange physiology that responds to\nelectricity. When together with Karrablast,\nShelmet evolves for some reason.
It moves with blinding speed and lobs poison at\nfoes. Featuring Accelgor as a main character is\na surefire way to make a movie or comic popular.
Discarding its shell made it nimble. To keep\nitself from dehydrating, it wraps its body in\nbands of membrane.
Thanks to bacteria that lived in the mud flats with\nit, this Pokémon developed the organs it uses to\ngenerate electricity.
For some reason, this Pokémon smiles slightly\nwhen it emits a strong electric current from the\nyellow markings on its body.
In one minute, a well-trained Mienfoo can chop\nwith its arms more than 100 times.
Though small, Mienfoo’s temperament is fierce.\nAny creature that approaches Mienfoo carelessly\nwill be greeted with a flurry of graceful attacks.
When Mienshao comes across a truly challenging\nopponent, it will lighten itself by biting off the\nfur on its arms.
Delivered at blinding speeds, kicks from this\nPokémon can shatter massive boulders into\ntiny pieces.
Druddigon lives in caves, but it never skips\nsunbathing—it won’t be able to move if its body\ngets too cold.
Druddigon are vicious and cunning. They take up\nresidence in nests dug out by other Pokémon,\ntreating the stolen nests as their own lairs.
They were sculpted from clay in ancient times.\nNo one knows why, but some of them are driven\nto continually line up boulders.
This Pokémon was created from clay. It received\norders from its master many thousands of years\nago, and it still follows those orders to this day.
Artillery platforms built into the walls of ancient\ncastles served as perches from which Golurk\ncould fire energy beams.
There’s a theory that inside Golurk is a perpetual\nmotion machine that produces limitless energy,\nbut this belief hasn’t been proven.
It uses river stones to maintain the cutting edges\nof the blades covering its body. These sharpened\nblades allow it to bring down opponents.
A pack of these Pokémon forms to serve a\nBisharp boss. Each Pawniard trains diligently,\ndreaming of one day taking the lead.
It’s accompanied by a large retinue of Pawniard.\nBisharp keeps a keen eye on its minions, ensuring\nnone of them even think of double-crossing it.
Violent conflicts erupt between Bisharp and\nFraxure over places where sharpening stones\ncan be found.
These Pokémon can crush a car with no more\nthan a headbutt. Bouffalant with more hair on\ntheir heads hold higher positions within the herd.
These Pokémon live in herds of about 20\nindividuals. Bouffalant that betray the herd will\nlose the hair on their heads for some reason.
If it spies a strong Pokémon, Rufflet can’t resist\nchallenging it to a battle. But if Rufflet loses,\nit starts bawling.
A combative Pokémon, it’s ready to pick a fight\nwith anyone. It has talons that can crush\nhard berries.
Known for its bravery and pride, this majestic\nPokémon is often seen as a motif for various\nkinds of emblems.
Because this Pokémon is hotheaded and\nbelligerent, it’s Corviknight that’s taken\nthe role of transportation in Galar.
It wears a bone to protect its rear.\nIt often squabbles with others of its kind over\nparticularly comfy bones.
Vullaby grow quickly. Bones that have gotten too\nsmall for older Vullaby to wear often get passed\ndown to younger ones in the nest.
Although it’s a bit of a ruffian, this Pokémon will\ntake lost Vullaby under its wing and care for them\ntill they’re ready to leave the nest.
They adorn themselves with bones. There seem\nto be fashion trends among them, as different\nbones come into and fall out of popularity.
There’s a hole in its tail that allows it to draw in\nthe air it needs to keep its fire burning. If the\nhole gets blocked, this Pokémon will fall ill.
A flame serves as its tongue, melting through the\nhard shell of Durant so that Heatmor can devour\ntheir insides.
They lay their eggs deep inside their nests.\nWhen attacked by Heatmor, they retaliate\nusing their massive mandibles.
With their large mandibles, these Pokémon can\ncrunch their way through rock. They work\ntogether to protect their eggs from Sandaconda.
When it encounters something, its first urge is\nusually to bite it. If it likes what it tastes, it will\ncommit the associated scent to memory.
Because it can’t see, this Pokémon is constantly\nbiting at everything it touches, trying to keep\ntrack of its surroundings.
While hunting for prey, Zweilous wanders its\nterritory, its two heads often bickering over\nwhich way to go.
Their two heads will fight each other over a\nsingle piece of food. Zweilous are covered in\nscars even without battling others.
There are a slew of stories about villages that\nwere destroyed by Hydreigon. It bites anything\nthat moves.
The three heads take turns sinking their teeth into\nthe opponent. Their attacks won’t slow until their\ntarget goes down.
The people of ancient times believed that\nLarvesta fell from the sun.
Larvesta’s body is warm all over. It spouts fire\nfrom the tips of its horns to intimidate predators\nand scare prey.
Volcarona scatters burning scales. Some say it\ndoes this to start fires. Others say it’s trying to\nrescue those that suffer in the cold.
This Pokémon emerges from a cocoon formed of\nraging flames. Ancient murals depict Volcarona as\na deity of fire.
This Pokémon appears in a legend alongside\nTerrakion and Virizion, fighting against humans in\ndefense of the Unova region’s Pokémon.
From the moment it’s born, this Pokémon\nradiates the air of a leader. Its presence will\ncalm even vicious foes.
It has phenomenal power. It will mercilessly crush\nanyone or anything that bullies small Pokémon.
In Unovan legend, Terrakion battled against\nhumans in an effort to protect other Pokémon.
A legend tells of this Pokémon working\ntogether with Cobalion and Terrakion to\nprotect the Pokémon of the Unova region.
It darts around opponents with a flurry of quick\nmovements, slicing them up with its horns.
Flames spew from its tail as it flies through the\nsky like a jet airplane. It’s said that this Pokémon\nwill scorch the world.
According to myth, if people ignore truth and\nlet themselves become consumed by greed,\nReshiram will arrive to burn their kingdoms down.
When the interior part of its tail spins like a\nmotor, Zekrom can generate many bolts of\nlightning to blast its surroundings.
Mythology tells us that if people lose the\nrighteousness in their hearts, their kingdoms\nwill be razed by Zekrom’s lightning.
Dwelling within it is a power even greater than\nthat of Reshiram or Zekrom, but the extreme\ncold keeps that power bound.
It appears that this Pokémon uses its powers over\nice to freeze its own body in order to stabilize its\ncellular structure.
Cobalion, Terrakion, and Virizion taught this\nPokémon how to fight. It dashes across the world,\nseeking more opportunities to further its training.
They say that Keldeo must survive harsh battles\nand fully develop the horn on its forehead\nbefore this Pokémon’s true power will awaken.
It excels at digging holes. Using its ears, it can\ndig a nest 33 feet deep in one night.
It’s very sensitive to danger. The sound of\nCorviknight’s flapping will have Bunnelby\ndigging a hole to hide underground in moments.
With power equal to an excavator, it can dig\nthrough dense bedrock. It’s a huge help during\ntunnel construction.
The fur on its belly retains heat exceptionally\nwell. People used to make heavy winter clothing\nfrom fur shed by this Pokémon.
Its melodious cries are actually warnings.\nFletchling will mercilessly peck at anything\nthat enters its territory.
When this Pokémon gets excited, its body\ntemperature increases sharply. If you touch a\nFletchling with bare hands, you might get burned.
Fletchinder launches embers into the den of\nits prey. When the prey comes leaping out,\nFletchinder’s sharp talons finish it off.
Fletchinder are exceedingly territorial and\naggressive. These Pokémon fight among\nthemselves over feeding grounds.
Talonflame mainly preys upon other bird\nPokémon. To intimidate opponents, it sends\nembers spewing from gaps between its feathers.
Talonflame dives toward prey at speeds of up to\n310 mph and assaults them with powerful kicks,\ngiving the prey no chance to escape.
It chooses a Pangoro as its master and then\nimitates its master’s actions. This is how it learns\nto battle and hunt for prey.
Wanting to make sure it’s taken seriously,\nPancham’s always giving others a glare.\nBut if it’s not focusing, it ends up smiling.
This Pokémon is quick to anger, and it has no\nproblem using its prodigious strength to get its\nway. It lives for duels against Obstagoon.
Using its leaf, Pangoro can predict the moves of\nits opponents. It strikes with punches that can\nturn a dump truck into scrap with just one hit.
Though Espurr’s expression never changes,\nbehind that blank stare is an intense struggle to\ncontain its devastating psychic power.
There’s enough psychic power in Espurr to send a\nwrestler flying, but because this power can’t be\ncontrolled, Espurr finds it troublesome.
Revealing the eyelike patterns on the insides of\nits ears will unleash its psychic powers. It normally\nkeeps the patterns hidden, however.
The defensive instinct of the males is strong.\nIt’s when they’re protecting themselves or their\npartners that they unleash their full power.
Honedge’s soul once belonged to a person who\nwas killed a long time ago by the sword that\nmakes up Honedge’s body.
The blue eye on the sword’s handguard is the\ntrue body of Honedge. With its old cloth, it\ndrains people’s lives away.
Honedge evolves into twins. The two blades\nrub together to emit a metallic sound that\nunnerves opponents.
The two swords employ a strategy of rapidly\nalternating between offense and defense to\nbring down their prey.
In this defensive stance, Aegislash uses its steel\nbody and a force field of spectral power to\nreduce the damage of any attack.
Its potent spectral powers allow it to manipulate\nothers. It once used its powers to force people\nand Pokémon to build a kingdom to its liking.
A scent pouch within this Pokémon’s body allows\nit to create various scents. A change in its diet\nwill alter the fragrance it produces.
The scent its body gives off enraptures those\nwho smell it. Noble ladies had no shortage of\nlove for Spritzee.
The scent that constantly emits from its fur is so\npowerful that this Pokémon’s companions will\neventually lose their sense of smell.
The scents Aromatisse can produce range from\nsweet smells that bolster allies to foul smells\nthat sap an opponent’s will to fight.
It eats its own weight in sugar every day.\nIf it doesn’t get enough sugar, it becomes\nincredibly grumpy.
The sweet smell of cotton candy perfumes\nSwirlix’s fluffy fur. This Pokémon spits out\nsticky string to tangle up its enemies.
By taking in a person’s scent, it can sniff out their\nmental and physical condition. It’s hoped that\nthis skill will have many medical applications.
Slurpuff’s fur contains a lot of air, making it soft\nto the touch and lighter than it looks.
It spins while making its luminescent spots flash.\nThese spots allow it to communicate with others\nby using different patterns of light.
By exposing foes to the blinking of its\nluminescent spots, Inkay demoralizes them,\nand then it seizes the chance to flee.
Gazing at its luminescent spots will quickly\ninduce a hypnotic state, putting the observer\nunder Malamar’s control.
It’s said that Malamar’s hypnotic powers played\na role in certain history-changing events.
After two Binacle find a suitably sized rock, they\nadhere themselves to it and live together.\nThey cooperate to gather food during high tide.
If the two don’t work well together, both their\noffense and defense fall apart. Without good\nteamwork, they won’t survive.
Seven Binacle come together to form one\nBarbaracle. The Binacle that serves as the head\ngives orders to those serving as the limbs.
Having an eye on each palm allows it to keep\nwatch in all directions. In a pinch, its limbs start\nto act on their own to ensure the enemy’s defeat.
It drifts in the ocean, blending in with floating\nseaweed. When other Pokémon come to feast on\nthe seaweed, Skrelp feasts on them instead.
Skrelp looks like a piece of rotten seaweed, so it\ncan blend in with seaweed drifting on the ocean\nand avoid being detected by enemies.
Dragalge uses a poisonous liquid capable of\ncorroding metal to send tankers that enter its\nterritory to the bottom of the sea.
Dragalge generates dragon energy by sticking\nthe plume on its head out above the ocean’s\nsurface and bathing it in sunlight.
Clauncher’s claws can fall off during battle, but\nthey’ll regenerate. The meat inside the claws is\npopular as a delicacy in Galar.
By detonating gas that accumulates in its right\nclaw, this Pokémon launches water like a bullet.\nThis is how Clauncher defeats its enemies.
After using the feelers on its oversized claw to\ndetect the location of prey, Clawitzer launches\na cannonball of water at its target.
Clawitzer’s right arm is a cannon that launches\nprojectiles made of seawater. Shots from a\nClawitzer’s cannon arm can sink a tanker.
When spread, the frills on its head act like solar\npanels, generating the power behind this\nPokémon’s electric moves.
The sun powers this Pokémon’s electricity\ngeneration. Interruption of that process\nstresses Helioptile to the point of weakness.
A now-vanished desert culture treasured these\nPokémon. Appropriately, when Heliolisk came to\nthe Galar region, treasure came with them.
One Heliolisk basking in the sun with its frill\noutspread is all it would take to produce enough\nelectricity to power a city.
This is an ancient Pokémon, revived in modern\ntimes. It has a violent disposition, and it’ll tear\napart anything it gets between its hefty jaws.
This Pokémon is selfish and likes to be pampered.\nIt can also inflict grievous wounds on its Trainer\njust by playing around.
This Pokémon is from about 100,000,000\nyears ago. It has the presence of a king, vicious\nbut magnificent.
A single bite of Tyrantrum’s massive jaws will\ndemolish a car. This Pokémon was the king of the\nancient world.
This Pokémon was successfully restored from a\nfossil. In the past, it lived with others of its kind\nin cold lands where there were fewer predators.
Amaura is an ancient Pokémon that has gone\nextinct. Specimens of this species can sometimes\nbe found frozen in ice.
Aurorus was restored from a fossil. It’s said that\nwhen this Pokémon howls, auroras appear in the\nnight sky.
When gripped by rage, Aurorus will emanate\nfreezing air, covering everything around it in ice.
By releasing enmity-erasing waves from its\nribbonlike feelers, Sylveon stops any conflict.
There’s a Galarian fairy tale that describes\na beautiful Sylveon vanquishing a dreadful\ndragon Pokémon.
It drives its opponents to exhaustion with its agile\nmaneuvers, then ends the fight with a flashy\nfinishing move.
It always strikes a pose before going for its\nfinishing move. Sometimes opponents take\nadvantage of that time to counterattack.
A Dedenne’s whiskers pick up electrical waves\nother Dedenne send out. These Pokémon share\nlocations of food or electricity with one another.
Since Dedenne can’t generate much electricity on\nits own, it steals electricity from outlets or other\nelectric Pokémon.
When beset by attackers, Carbink wipes them all\nout by firing high-energy beams from the gems\nembedded in its body.
It’s said that somewhere in the world, there’s\na mineral vein housing a large pack of slumbering\nCarbink. It’s also said that this pack has a queen.
Because most of its body is water, it will dry up if\nthe weather becomes too arid. It’s considered\nthe weakest dragon Pokémon.
Their horns are powerful sensors. As soon as\nGoomy pick up any sign of enemies, they go into\nhiding. This is how they’ve survived.
Although this Pokémon isn’t very strong, its body\nis coated in a caustic slime that can melt through\nanything, so predators steer clear of it.
The lump on its back contains its tiny brain.\nIt thinks only of food and escaping its enemies.
Sometimes it misunderstands instructions and\nappears dazed or bewildered. Many Trainers\ndon’t mind, finding this behavior to be adorable.
Its form of offense is forcefully stretching out its\nhorns. The strikes land 100 times harder than any\nblow from a heavyweight boxer.
This Pokémon is constantly collecting keys.\nEntrust a Klefki with important keys, and the\nPokémon will protect them no matter what.
Klefki sucks in metal ions with the horn topping\nits head. It seems this Pokémon loves keys so\nmuch that its head needed to look like one, too.
After a lost child perished in the forest, their\nspirit possessed a tree stump, causing the spirit’s\nrebirth as this Pokémon.
With a voice like a human child’s, it cries out to\nlure adults deep into the forest, getting them lost\namong the trees.
People fear it due to a belief that it devours any\nwho try to cut down trees in its forest, but to the\nPokémon it shares its woods with, it’s kind.
Small roots that extend from the tips of this\nPokémon’s feet can tie into the trees of the\nforest and give Trevenant control over them.
Spirits that wander this world are placed into\nPumpkaboo’s body. They’re then moved on to\nthe afterlife.
The light that streams out from the holes in the\npumpkin can hypnotize and control the people\nand Pokémon that see it.
Eerie cries emanate from its body in the dead of\nnight. The sounds are said to be the wails of\nspirits who are suffering in the afterlife.
In the darkness of a new-moon night, Gourgeist\nwill come knocking. Whoever answers the door\nwill be swept off to the afterlife.
They chill the air around them to −150 degrees\nFahrenheit, freezing the water in the air into ice\nthat they use as armor.
This Pokémon lives in areas of frigid cold.\nIt secures itself to the back of an Avalugg\nby freezing its feet in place.
At high latitudes, this Pokémon can be found\nwith clusters of Bergmite on its back as it swims\namong the icebergs.
As Avalugg moves about during the day,\nthe cracks in its body deepen. The Pokémon’s\nbody returns to a pristine state overnight.
After nightfall, they emerge from the caves they\nnest in during the day. Using their ultrasonic\nwaves, they go on the hunt for ripened fruit.
No wavelength of sound is beyond Noibat’s\nability to produce. The ultrasonic waves it\ngenerates can overcome much larger Pokémon.
Aggressive and cruel, this Pokémon will ruthlessly\ntorment enemies that are helpless in the dark.
Flying through the darkness, it weakens enemies\nwith ultrasonic waves that could crush stone.\nIts fangs finish the fight.
At a distance, it launches its sharp feathers while\nflying about. If the enemy gets too close, Rowlet\nswitches tactics and delivers vicious kicks.
During the day, it builds up energy via\nphotosynthesis. At night, it flies silently\nthrough the sky, on the prowl for prey.
It throws one knifelike feather after another at its\nenemies, and each one precisely strikes a weak\npoint. These feathers are known as blade quills.
It never slacks when it comes to the task of\ncleaning its feathers. Thorough preening keeps it\nlooking spiffy and its blade quills nice and sharp.
As if wielding a bow, it launches the arrow quills\nhidden among the feathers of its wings.\nDecidueye’s shots never miss.
In a tenth of a second, it can nock and fire an\narrow quill, piercing an opponent’s weak point\nbefore they notice what’s happening.
It spends even the smallest amount of downtime\ngrooming its fur with its tongue. Loose fur gathers\nin its stomach and serves as fuel for fiery moves.
Trying to pet Litten before it trusts you will\nresult in a nasty scratch from its sharp claws.\nBe careful.
In the midst of battle, the fire pouch on\nTorracat’s neck rings like a bell and produces\nstronger flames than usual.
When facing a powerful enemy, Torracat’s\nfighting spirit gets pumped up, and its fire bell\nblazes hotter.
It excels at violent, no-holds-barred battles.\nThe temperature of the flames that issue from its\nnavel exceeds 3,600 degrees Fahrenheit.
Incineroar’s rough and aggressive behavior is its\nmost notable trait, but the way it helps out small\nPokémon shows that it has a kind side as well.
It creates special bouncy balloons to send at its\nopponents. When the balloons pop, the sheer\nforce of their bursting is what deals damage.
If Popplio want to create big, powerful balloons,\nthey must be persistent. It takes daily practice for\nthese Pokémon to develop their skills.
As if dancing, it artfully dodges the attacks of its\nenemies. All the while, it’s busy forming a bunch\nof balloons to overwhelm its foes.
On nights when the sea is calm, Brionne dance\nwith one another to the singing of the Primarina\nthat’s leading them.
With its mouth, it makes sonic waves that sound\nlike beautiful singing. It uses the sonic waves to\ncontrol its water balloons.
For Primarina, every battle’s a stage. Its singing\nand the dancing of its balloons will mesmerize\nthe audience.
Its natural enemies, like Rookidee, may\nflee rather than risk getting caught in its large\nmandibles that can snap thick tree branches.
It uses its big jaws to dig nests into the forest\nfloor, and it loves to feed on sweet tree sap.
While its durable shell protects it from attacks,\nCharjabug strikes at enemies with jolts of\nelectricity discharged from the tips of its jaws.
Its digestive processes convert the leaves it eats\ninto electricity. An electric sac in its belly stores\nthe electricity for later use.
It builds up electricity in its abdomen, focuses it\nthrough its jaws, and then fires the electricity off\nin concentrated beams.
If it carries a Charjabug to use as a spare battery,\na flying Vikavolt can rapidly fire high-powered\nbeams of electricity.
Nectar and pollen are its favorite fare. You can\nfind Cutiefly hovering around Gossifleur, trying\nto get some of Gossifleur’s pollen.
An opponent’s aura can tell Cutiefly what that\nopponent’s next move will be. Then Cutiefly can\nglide around the attack and strike back.
It makes pollen puffs from pollen and nectar.\nThe puffs’ effects depend on the type of\ningredients and how much of each one is used.
Ribombee absolutely hate getting wet or\nrained on. In the cloudy Galar region,\nthey are very seldom seen.
This Pokémon can bond very strongly with its\nTrainer, but it also has a habit of biting. Raising\na Rockruff for a long time can be challenging.
This Pokémon intimidates opponents by striking\nthe ground with the rocks on its neck. The\nmoment an opponent flinches, Rockruff attacks.
This Lycanroc is calm and cautious. The rocks\njutting from its mane are razor sharp.
With swift movements, this Pokémon gradually\nbacks its prey into a corner. Lycanroc’s fangs are\nalways aimed toward opponents’ weak spots.
Individually, they’re incredibly weak. It’s by\ngathering up into schools that they’re able\nto confront opponents.
When it senses danger, its eyes tear up.\nThe sparkle of its tears signals other\nWishiwashi to gather.
The first symptom of its sting is numbness.\nThe next is an itching sensation so intense that it’s\nimpossible to resist the urge to claw at your skin.
Unlike their Alolan counterparts, the Mareanie\nof the Galar region have not yet figured out\nthat the branches of Corsola are delicious.
To survive in the cold waters of Galar, this\nPokémon forms a dome with its legs, enclosing\nits body so it can capture its own body heat.
Within the poison sac in its body is a poison so\ntoxic that Pokémon as large as Wailord will still\nbe suffering three days after it first takes effect.
Loads weighing up to 50 times as much as its\nown body weight pose no issue for this Pokémon.\nIt’s skilled at making use of mud.
It eats dirt to create mud and smears this mud all\nover its feet, giving them the grip needed to walk\non rough terrain without slipping.
Mud that hardens around a Mudsdale’s legs\nsets harder than stone. It’s so hard that it allows\nthis Pokémon to scrap a truck with a single kick.
Mudsdale has so much stamina that it could carry\nover 10 tons across the Galar region without rest\nor sleep.
It forms a water bubble at the rear of its body\nand then covers its head with it. Meeting another\nDewpider means comparing water-bubble sizes.
Dewpider normally lives underwater. When it\ncomes onto land in search of food, it takes\nwater with it in the form of a bubble on its head.
It launches water bubbles with its legs, drowning\nprey within the bubbles. This Pokémon can then\ntake its time to savor its meal.
It acts as a caretaker for Dewpider, putting them\ninside its bubble and letting them eat any\nleftover food.
When bathed in sunlight, this Pokémon emits a\npleasantly sweet scent, which causes bug\nPokémon to gather around it.
During the day, Fomantis basks in sunlight and\nsleeps peacefully. It wakes and moves around\nat night.
This Pokémon resembles a beautiful flower.\nA properly raised Lurantis will have gorgeous,\nbrilliant colors.
The petals on this Pokémon’s arms are thin and\nsuper sharp, and they can fire laser beams if\nLurantis gathers light first.
Pokémon living in the forest eat the\ndelicious caps on Morelull’s head.\nThe caps regrow overnight.
Morelull live in forests that stay dark even\nduring the day. They scatter flickering spores\nthat put enemies to sleep.
Its flickering spores lure in prey and put them to\nsleep. Once this Pokémon has its prey snoozing,\nit drains their vitality with its fingertips.
If you see a light deep in a forest at night,\ndon’t go near. Shiinotic will make you fall\nfast asleep.
Its venom sacs produce a fluid that this\nPokémon then heats up with the flame in its tail.\nThis process creates Salandit’s poisonous gas.
This sneaky Pokémon will slink behind its prey\nand immobilize it with poisonous gas before the\nprey even realizes Salandit is there.
Only female Salazzle exist. They emit a gas laden\nwith pheromones to captivate male Salandit.
The winner of competitions between Salazzle\nis decided by which one has the most male\nSalandit with it.
Its fluffy fur is a delight to pet, but carelessly\nreaching out to touch this Pokémon could result\nin painful retaliation.
The way it protects itself by flailing its arms may\nbe an adorable sight, but stay well away. This is\nflailing that can snap thick tree trunks.
Once it accepts you as a friend, it tries to show\nits affection with a hug. Letting it do that is\ndangerous—it could easily shatter your bones.
The moves it uses to take down its prey would\nmake a martial artist jealous. It tucks subdued\nprey under its arms to carry them to its nest.
Its body gives off a sweet, fruity scent that is\nextremely appetizing to bird Pokémon.
When under attack, it secretes a sweet\nand delicious sweat. The scent only calls\nmore enemies to it.
As it twirls like a dancer, a sweet smell spreads\nout around it. Anyone who inhales the scent will\nfeel a surge of happiness.
Any Corvisquire that pecks at this\nPokémon will be greeted with a smack from\nits sepals followed by a sharp kick.
This feared Pokémon has long, slender legs and\na cruel heart. It shows no mercy as it stomps on\nits opponents.
A kick from the hardened tips of this Pokémon’s\nlegs leaves a wound in the opponent’s body and\nsoul that will never heal.
Comfey picks flowers with its vine and decorates\nitself with them. For some reason, flowers won’t\nwither once they’re attached to a Comfey.
These Pokémon smell very nice. All Comfey wear\ndifferent flowers, so each of these Pokémon has\nits own individual scent.
With waves of its fan—made from leaves and its\nown fur—Oranguru skillfully gives instructions to\nother Pokémon.
It knows the forest inside and out. If it comes\nacross a wounded Pokémon, Oranguru will\ngather medicinal herbs to treat it.
Displaying amazing teamwork, they follow the\norders of their boss as they all help out in the\nsearch for their favorite berries.
Passimian live in groups of about 20, with\neach member performing an assigned role.\nThrough cooperation, the group survives.
It’s nature’s cleaner—it eats anything and\neverything, including garbage and rotten things.\nThe ground near its nest is always clean.
Wimpod gather in swarms, constantly on the\nlookout for danger. They scatter the moment\nthey detect an enemy’s presence.
It will do anything to win, taking advantage of\nevery opening and finishing opponents off with\nthe small claws on its front legs.
They live in sunken ships or in holes in the\nseabed. When Golisopod and Grapploct\nbattle, the loser becomes the winner’s meal.
Grudges of the dead have possessed a mound of\nsand and become a Pokémon. Sandygast is fond\nof the shovel on its head.
Sandygast mainly inhabits beaches. It takes\ncontrol of anyone who puts their hand into its\nmouth, forcing them to make its body bigger.
Palossand is known as the Beach Nightmare. It\npulls its prey down into the sand by controlling\nthe sand itself, and then it sucks out their souls.
This Pokémon lives on beaches, but it hates\nwater. Palossand can’t maintain its castle-like\nshape if it gets drenched by a heavy rain.
It lives in warm, shallow waters. If it encounters a\nfoe, it will spit out its internal organs as a means\nto punch them.
It’s covered in a slime that keeps its skin moist,\nallowing it to stay on land for days without\ndrying up.
Rumor has it that the theft of top-secret research\nnotes led to a new instance of this Pokémon\nbeing created in the Galar region.
It was modeled after a mighty Pokémon of myth.\nThe mask placed upon it limits its power in order\nto keep it under control.
A solid bond of trust between this Pokémon and\nits Trainer awakened the strength hidden within\nSilvally. It can change its type at will.
The final factor needed to release this\nPokémon’s true power was a strong bond\nwith a Trainer it trusts.
Explosive substances coat the shell on its back.\nEnemies that dare attack it will be blown away\nby an immense detonation.
Eating sulfur in its volcanic habitat is what causes\nexplosive compounds to develop in its shell.\nIts droppings are also dangerously explosive.
With the long hairs on its back, this Pokémon\ntakes in electricity from other electric Pokémon.\nIt stores what it absorbs in an electric sac.
When it’s in trouble, it curls up into a ball, makes\nits fur spikes stand on end, and then discharges\nelectricity indiscriminately.
It wears a rag fashioned into a Pikachu costume\nin an effort to look less scary. Unfortunately,\nthe costume only makes it creepier.
There was a scientist who peeked under\nMimikyu’s old rag in the name of research.\nThe scientist died of a mysterious disease.
The mountains it calls home are nearly two miles\nin height. On rare occasions, it descends to play\nwith the children living in the towns below.
Drampa is a kind and friendly Pokémon—up until\nit’s angered. When that happens, it stirs up a\ngale and flattens everything around.
After a piece of seaweed merged with debris\nfrom a sunken ship, it was reborn as this\nghost Pokémon.
After lowering its anchor, it waits for its prey. It\ncatches large Wailord and drains their life-force.
They learn to fight by smashing their head scales\ntogether. The dueling strengthens both their skills\nand their spirits.
Jangmo-o strikes its scales to communicate with\nothers of its kind. Its scales are actually fur that’s\nbecome as hard as metal.
The scaleless, scarred parts of its body are\nsigns of its strength. It shows them off to\ndefeated opponents.
Before attacking its enemies, it clashes its\nscales together and roars. Its sharp claws\nshred the opposition.
It clatters its tail scales to unnerve opponents.\nThis Pokémon will battle only those who stand\nsteadfast in the face of this display.
Certain ruins have paintings of ancient warriors\nwearing armor made of Kommo-o scales.
This Pokémon came from another universe.\nIts gaseous body is so light that even a gentle\nbreeze can blow it away.
Cosmog is very curious but not very cautious,\noften placing itself in danger. If things start to\nlook dicey, it teleports away.
The absorption of starlight fuels this Pokémon’s\ngrowth. The shell that encases it is harder than\nany known material.
It sucks in dust from the air at an astounding rate,\nfrantically building up energy within its core as\npreparation for evolution.
When light radiates from its body, this Pokémon\ncould almost appear to be the sun. It will dispel\nany darkness and light up the world.
Solgaleo was once known as the Beast That\nDevours the Sun. Energy in the form of light\nradiates boundlessly from it.
Known as the Beast That Calls the Moon, this\nPokémon lives by taking in any and all light and\nconverting it into its own energy.
It steals the light from its surroundings and then\nbecomes the full moon, showering its own light\nacross the night sky.
It survives by absorbing light. After a long time\nspent slumbering underground, impurities\naccumulated within it, causing its body to darken.
It needs light to survive, and it goes on a\nrampage seeking it out. Its laser beams will\ncut anything to pieces.
By slipping into the shadow of a martial arts\nmaster and copying their movements, this\nPokémon learned the ultimate techniques.
This Pokémon can conceal itself in any shadow,\nso it went undiscovered for a long time.
It runs as fast as lightning strikes, shredding its\nopponents with its high-voltage claws.
Electricity sparks from the pads on its limbs.\nWherever Zeraora runs, lightning flashes and\nthunder echoes.
It dissolves and eats metal. Circulating liquid\nmetal within its body is how it generates energy.
They live as a group, but when the time comes,\none strong Meltan will absorb all the others\nand evolve.
At the end of its life-span, Melmetal will rust and\nfall apart. The small shards left behind will\neventually be reborn as Meltan.
Centrifugal force is behind the punches of\nMelmetal’s heavy hex-nut arms. Melmetal is said\nto deliver the strongest punches of all Pokémon.
When it uses its special stick to strike up a beat,\nthe sound waves produced carry revitalizing\nenergy to the plants and flowers in the area.
It attacks with rapid beats of its stick.\nAs it strikes with amazing speed, it gets\nmore and more pumped.
The faster a Thwackey can beat out a rhythm\nwith its two sticks, the more respect it wins from\nits peers.
When it’s drumming out rapid beats in battle, it\ngets so caught up in the rhythm that it won’t even\nnotice that it’s already knocked out its opponent.
By drumming, it taps into the power of its special\ntree stump. The roots of the stump follow its\ndirection in battle.
The one with the best drumming techniques\nbecomes the boss of the troop. It has a gentle\ndisposition and values harmony among its group.
A warm-up of running around gets fire energy\ncoursing through this Pokémon’s body. Once that\nhappens, it’s ready to fight at full power.
It has special pads on the backs of its feet, and\none on its nose. Once it’s raring to fight, these\npads radiate tremendous heat.
Its thick and fluffy fur protects it from the cold\nand enables it to use hotter fire moves.
It kicks berries right off the branches of trees\nand then juggles them with its feet, practicing\nits footwork.
It juggles a pebble with its feet, turning it into a\nburning soccer ball. Its shots strike opponents\nhard and leave them scorched.
It’s skilled at both offense and defense, and it\ngets pumped up when cheered on. But if it starts\nshowboating, it could put itself in a tough spot.
When scared, this Pokémon cries. Its tears pack\nthe chemical punch of 100 onions, and attackers\nwon’t be able to resist weeping.
When it gets wet, its skin changes color,\nand this Pokémon becomes invisible as if\nit were camouflaged.
A clever combatant, this Pokémon battles using\nwater balloons created with moisture secreted\nfrom its palms.
Highly intelligent but also very lazy,\nit keeps enemies out of its territory\nby laying traps everywhere.
It has many hidden capabilities, such as fingertips\nthat can shoot water and a membrane on its back\nthat it can use to glide through the air.
Its nictitating membranes let it pick out foes’\nweak points so it can precisely blast them with\nwater that shoots from its fingertips at Mach 3.
Found throughout the Galar region, this Pokémon\nbecomes uneasy if its cheeks are ever completely\nempty of berries.
It eats berries nonstop—a habit that has made\nit more resilient than it looks. It’ll show up on\nfarms, searching for yet more berries.
It stashes berries in its tail—so many berries that\nthey fall out constantly. But this Pokémon is a bit\nslow-witted, so it doesn’t notice the loss.
Common throughout the Galar region, this\nPokémon has strong teeth and can chew\nthrough the toughest of berry shells.
It will bravely challenge any opponent, no matter\nhow powerful. This Pokémon benefits from every\nbattle—even a defeat increases its strength a bit.
Jumping nimbly about, this small-bodied\nPokémon takes advantage of even the slightest\nopportunity to disorient larger opponents.
Smart enough to use tools in battle, these\nPokémon have been seen picking up rocks and\nflinging them or using ropes to wrap up enemies.
The lessons of many harsh battles have taught it\nhow to accurately judge an opponent’s strength.
This Pokémon reigns supreme in the skies of the\nGalar region. The black luster of its steel body\ncould drive terror into the heart of any foe.
With their great intellect and flying skills, these\nPokémon very successfully act as the Galar\nregion’s airborne taxi service.
A constant collector of information, this Pokémon\nis very smart. Very strong is what it isn’t.
Often found in gardens, this Pokémon has hairs\non its body that it uses to assess its surroundings.
It barely moves, but it’s still alive. Hiding in its\nshell without food or water seems to have\nawakened its psychic powers.
As it grows inside its shell, it uses its psychic\nabilities to monitor the outside world and\nprepare for evolution.
It’s famous for its high level of intelligence, and\nthe large size of its brain is proof that it also\npossesses immense psychic power.
It emits psychic energy to observe and study\nwhat’s around it—and what’s around it can\ninclude things over six miles away.
Aided by the soft pads on its feet, it silently raids\nthe food stores of other Pokémon. It survives off\nits ill-gotten gains.
Cunning and cautious, this Pokémon survives by\nstealing food from others. It erases its tracks with\nswipes of its tail as it makes off with its plunder.
It secretly marks potential targets with a scent.\nBy following the scent, it stalks its targets\nand steals from them when they least expect it.
With a lithe body and sharp claws, it goes\naround stealing food and eggs. Boltund\nis its natural enemy.
It anchors itself in the ground with its single leg,\nthen basks in the sun. After absorbing enough\nsunlight, its petals spread as it blooms brilliantly.
It whirls around in the wind while singing a joyous\nsong. This delightful display has charmed many\ninto raising this Pokémon.
The seeds attached to its cotton fluff are full of\nnutrients. It spreads them on the wind so that\nplants and other Pokémon can benefit from them.
The cotton on the head of this Pokémon can be\nspun into a glossy, gorgeous yarn—a Galar\nregional specialty.
Its curly fleece is such an effective cushion that\nthis Pokémon could fall off a cliff and stand right\nback up at the bottom, unharmed.
If its fleece grows too long, Wooloo won’t be\nable to move. Cloth made with the wool of this\nPokémon is surprisingly strong.
Weave a carpet from its springy wool, and you end\nup with something closer to a trampoline. You’ll\nstart to bounce the moment you set foot on it.
Its majestic horns are meant only to impress the\nopposite gender. They never see use in battle.
Apparently the itch of its teething impels it to\nsnap its jaws at anything in front of it.
It starts off battles by attacking with its rock-hard\nhorn, but as soon as the opponent flinches, this\nPokémon bites down and never lets go.
With jaws that can shear through steel rods,\nthis highly aggressive Pokémon chomps down\non its unfortunate prey.
This Pokémon rapidly extends its retractable neck\nto sink its sharp fangs into distant enemies and\ntake them down.
This Pokémon is very popular as a herding dog\nin the Galar region. As it runs, it generates\nelectricity from the base of its tail.
This gluttonous Pokémon only assists people with\ntheir work because it wants treats. As it runs,\nit crackles with electricity.
This Pokémon generates electricity and channels\nit into its legs to keep them going strong.\nBoltund can run nonstop for three full days.
It sends electricity through its legs to boost their\nstrength. Running at top speed, it easily breaks\n50 mph.
Most of its body has the same composition as\ncoal. Fittingly, this Pokémon was first discovered\nin coal mines about 400 years ago.
It can race around like a unicycle, even on rough,\nrocky terrain. Burning coal sustains it.
It forms coal inside its body. Coal dropped by\nthis Pokémon once helped fuel the lives of\npeople in the Galar region.
By rapidly rolling its legs, it can travel at over\n18 mph. The temperature of the flames it\nbreathes exceeds 1,800 degrees Fahrenheit.
It’s usually peaceful, but the vandalism of mines\nenrages it. Offenders will be incinerated with\nflames that reach 2,700 degrees Fahrenheit.
While it’s engaged in battle, its mountain of coal\nwill burn bright red, sending off sparks that\nscorch the surrounding area.
It spends its entire life inside an apple. It hides\nfrom its natural enemies, bird Pokémon, by\npretending it’s just an apple and nothing more.
As soon as it’s born, it burrows into an apple. Not\nonly does the apple serve as its food source, but\nthe flavor of the fruit determines its evolution.
It ate a sour apple, and that induced its\nevolution. In its cheeks, it stores an acid\ncapable of causing chemical burns.
It flies on wings of apple skin and spits a\npowerful acid. It can also change its shape\ninto that of an apple.
Eating a sweet apple caused its evolution.\nA nectarous scent wafts from its body, luring in\nthe bug Pokémon it preys on.
Its body is covered in sweet nectar, and the\nskin on its back is especially yummy. Children\nused to have it as a snack.
As it digs, it swallows sand and stores it in its\nneck pouch. The pouch can hold more than\n17 pounds of sand.
It spews sand from its nostrils. While the enemy\nis blinded, it burrows into the ground to hide.
When it contracts its body, over 220 pounds of\nsand sprays from its nose. If it ever runs out of\nsand, it becomes disheartened.
Its unique style of coiling allows it to blast sand\nout of its sand sac more efficiently.
It’s so strong that it can knock out some\nopponents in a single hit, but it also may\nforget what it’s battling midfight.
This hungry Pokémon swallows Arrokuda whole.\nOccasionally, it makes a mistake and tries to\nswallow a Pokémon other than its preferred prey.
If it sees any movement around it, this Pokémon\ncharges for it straightaway, leading with its\nsharply pointed jaw. It’s very proud of that jaw.
After it’s eaten its fill, its movements become\nextremely sluggish. That’s when Cramorant\nswallows it up.
This Pokémon has a jaw that’s as sharp as a spear\nand as strong as steel. Apparently Barraskewda’s\nflesh is surprisingly tasty, too.
It spins its tail fins to propel itself, surging\nforward at speeds of over 100 knots before\nramming prey and spearing into them.
It stores poison in an internal poison sac and\nsecretes that poison through its skin. If you touch\nthis Pokémon, a tingling sensation follows.
It manipulates the chemical makeup of its poison\nto produce electricity. The voltage is weak, but it\ncan cause a tingling paralysis.
When this Pokémon sounds as if it’s strumming a\nguitar, it’s actually clawing at the protrusions on\nits chest to generate electricity.
This short-tempered and aggressive Pokémon\nchugs stagnant water to absorb any toxins it\nmight contain.
It stores flammable gas in its body and uses it to\ngenerate heat. The yellow sections on its belly\nget particularly hot.
It wraps prey up with its heated body, cooking\nthem in its coils. Once they’re well-done, it will\nvoraciously nibble them down to the last morsel.
When it heats up, its body temperature reaches\nabout 1,500 degrees Fahrenheit. It lashes its\nbody like a whip and launches itself at enemies.
While its burning body is already dangerous on\nits own, this excessively hostile Pokémon also has\nlarge and very sharp fangs.
It’s very curious, but its means of investigating\nthings is to try to punch them with its tentacles.\nThe search for food is what brings it onto land.
Its tentacles tear off easily, but it isn’t alarmed\nwhen that happens—it knows they’ll grow back.\nIt’s about as smart as a three-year-old.
A body made up of nothing but muscle makes\nthe grappling moves this Pokémon performs with\nits tentacles tremendously powerful.
Searching for an opponent to test its skills\nagainst, it emerges onto land. Once the battle\nis over, it returns to the sea.
This Pokémon is said to have been born when\na lonely spirit possessed a cold, leftover cup\nof tea.
The teacup in which this Pokémon makes its\nhome is a famous piece of antique tableware.\nMany forgeries are in circulation.
This species lives in antique teapots.\nMost pots are forgeries, but on rare occasions,\nan authentic work is found.
Leaving leftover black tea unattended is asking\nfor this Pokémon to come along and pour itself\ninto it, turning the tea into a new Polteageist.
Via the protrusion on its head, it senses other\ncreatures’ emotions. If you don’t have a calm\ndisposition, it will never warm up to you.
If this Pokémon senses a strong emotion, it\nwill run away as fast as it can. It prefers areas\nwithout people.
No matter who you are, if you bring strong\nemotions near this Pokémon, it will silence\nyou violently.
Using the braids on its head, it pummels foes to\nget them to quiet down. One blow from those\nbraids would knock out a professional boxer.
It emits psychic power strong enough to cause\nheadaches as a deterrent to the approach\nof others.
If you’re too loud around it, you risk being torn\napart by the claws on its tentacle. This Pokémon\nis also known as the Forest Witch.
Through its nose, it sucks in the emanations\nproduced by people and Pokémon when they\nfeel annoyed. It thrives off this negative energy.
It sneaks into people’s homes, stealing things\nand feasting on the negative energy of the\nfrustrated occupants.
When it gets down on all fours as if to beg for\nforgiveness, it’s trying to lure opponents in so\nthat it can stab them with its spear-like hair.
With sly cunning, it tries to lure people into the\nwoods. Some believe it to have the power to\nmake crops grow.
With the hair wrapped around its body helping to\nenhance its muscles, this Pokémon can overwhelm\neven Machamp.
Its hairs work like muscle fibers. When its hairs\nunfurl, they latch on to opponents, ensnaring\nthem as tentacles would.
Its voice is staggering in volume. Obstagoon\nhas a tendency to take on a threatening posture\nand shout—this move is known as Obstruct.
It evolved after experiencing numerous fights.\nWhile crossing its arms, it lets out a shout that\nwould make any opponent flinch.
What appears to be an iron helmet is actually\nhardened hair. This Pokémon lives for the thrill\nof battle.
After many battles, it evolved dangerous\nclaws that come together to form daggers\nwhen extended.
Its shell is overflowing with its heightened\notherworldly energy. The ectoplasm serves as\nprotection for this Pokémon’s core spirit.
Be cautious of the ectoplasmic body\nsurrounding its soul. You’ll become\nstiff as stone if you touch it.
Only Farfetch’d that have survived many battles\ncan attain this evolution. When this Pokémon’s\nleek withers, it will retire from combat.
After deflecting attacks with its hard leaf shield,\nit strikes back with its sharp leek stalk. The leek\nstalk is both weapon and food.
It’s highly skilled at tap-dancing. It waves its cane\nof ice in time with its graceful movements.
Its amusing movements make it very popular.\nIt releases its psychic power from the pattern\non its belly.
A powerful curse was woven into an ancient\npainting. After absorbing the spirit of a Yamask,\nthe painting began to move.
Never touch its shadowlike body, or you’ll be\nshown the horrific memories behind the picture\ncarved into it.
This Pokémon was born from sweet-smelling\nparticles in the air. Its body is made of cream.
They say that any patisserie visited by Milcery\nis guaranteed success and good fortune.
When it trusts a Trainer, it will treat them to\nberries it’s decorated with cream.
When Alcremie is content, the cream it\nsecretes from its hands becomes sweeter\nand richer.
Five of them are troopers, and one is the brass.\nThe brass’s orders are absolute.
The six of them work together as one Pokémon.\nTeamwork is also their battle strategy, and they\nconstantly change their formation as they fight.
It feeds on seaweed, using its teeth to scrape it\noff rocks. Electric current flows from the tips of\nits spines.
It stores electricity in each spine. Even if one gets\nbroken off, it still continues to emit electricity for\nat least three hours.
It spits out thread imbued with a frigid sort of\nenergy and uses it to tie its body to branches,\ndisguising itself as an icicle while it sleeps.
It eats snow that piles up on the ground.\nThe more snow it eats, the bigger and more\nimpressive the spikes on its back grow.
Icy scales fall from its wings like snow as it flies\nover fields and mountains. The temperature of its\nwings is less than −290 degrees Fahrenheit.
It shows no mercy to any who desecrate fields\nand mountains. It will fly around on its icy wings,\ncausing a blizzard to chase offenders away.
It stands in grasslands, watching the sun’s descent\nfrom zenith to horizon. This Pokémon has a talent\nfor delivering dynamic kicks.
Once a year, on a specific date and at a specific\ntime, they gather out of nowhere and form up in\na circle.
It drifted in on the flow of ocean waters from a\nfrigid place. It keeps its head iced constantly to\nmake sure it stays nice and cold.
This Pokémon keeps its heat-sensitive head cool\nwith ice. It fishes for its food, dangling its single\nhair into the sea to lure in prey.
It uses the horns on its head to sense the\nemotions of others. Males will act as valets for\nthose they serve, looking after their every need.
Through its horns, it can pick up on the emotions\nof creatures around it. Positive emotions are the\nsource of its strength.
As it eats the seeds stored up in its pocket-like\npouches, this Pokémon is not just satisfying its\nconstant hunger. It’s also generating electricity.
It carries electrically roasted seeds with it as if\nthey’re precious treasures. No matter how much\nit eats, it always gets hungry again in short order.
It digs up the ground with its trunk. It’s also very\nstrong, being able to carry loads of over\nfive tons without any problem at all.
If a job requires serious strength, this Pokémon\nwill excel at it. Its copper body tarnishes in the\nrain, turning a vibrant green color.
They came over from another region long\nago and worked together with humans.\nTheir green skin is resistant to water.
These Pokémon live in herds. Their trunks have\nincredible grip strength, strong enough to crush\ngiant rocks into powder.
In ancient times, it was unbeatable thanks to its\npowerful lower body, but it went extinct anyway\nafter it depleted all its plant-based food sources.
The powerful muscles in its tail generate its\nelectricity. Compared to its lower body,\nits upper half is entirely too small.
The shaking of its freezing upper half is what\ngenerates its electricity. It has a hard time\nwalking around.
This Pokémon lived on prehistoric seashores and\nwas able to preserve food with the ice on its\nbody. It went extinct because it moved so slowly.
Powerful legs and jaws made it the apex predator\nof its time. Its own overhunting of its prey was\nwhat drove it to extinction.
Its mighty legs are capable of running at\nspeeds exceeding 40 mph, but this Pokémon\ncan’t breathe unless it’s underwater.
Though it’s able to capture prey by freezing its\nsurroundings, it has trouble eating the prey\nafterward because its mouth is on top of its head.
The skin on its face is impervious to attack, but\nbreathing difficulties made this Pokémon go\nextinct anyway.
Its body resembles polished metal, and it’s both\nlightweight and strong. The only drawback is that\nit rusts easily.
The special metal that composes its body is very\nlight, so this Pokémon has considerable agility.\nIt lives in caves because it dislikes the rain.
After being reborn as a ghost Pokémon,\nDreepy wanders the areas it used to inhabit\nback when it was alive in prehistoric seas.
If this weak Pokémon is by itself, a mere child\ncould defeat it. But if Dreepy has friends to help\nit train, it can evolve and become much stronger.
It’s capable of flying faster than 120 mph.\nIt battles alongside Dreepy and\ndotes on them until they successfully evolve.
Without a Dreepy to place on its head and\ncare for, it gets so uneasy it’ll try to substitute\nany Pokémon it finds for the missing Dreepy.
When it isn’t battling, it keeps Dreepy in the\nholes on its horns. Once a fight starts, it launches\nthe Dreepy like supersonic missiles.
Apparently the Dreepy inside Dragapult’s\nhorns eagerly look forward to being launched out\nat Mach speeds.
Known as a legendary hero, this Pokémon\nabsorbs metal particles, transforming them\ninto a weapon it uses to battle.
This Pokémon has slumbered for many years.\nSome say it’s Zamazenta’s elder sister—others\nsay the two Pokémon are rivals.
In times past, it worked together with a king of\nthe people to save the Galar region. It absorbs\nmetal that it then uses in battle.
This Pokémon slept for aeons while in the form of\na statue. It was asleep for so long, people forgot\nthat it ever existed.
The core on its chest absorbs energy emanating\nfrom the lands of the Galar region. This energy is\nwhat allows Eternatus to stay active.
It was inside a meteorite that fell 20,000 years\nago. There seems to be a connection between\nthis Pokémon and the Dynamax phenomenon.
Kubfu trains hard to perfect its moves. The moves\nit masters will determine which form it takes when\nit evolves.
If Kubfu pulls the long white hair on its head,\nits fighting spirit heightens and power wells up\nfrom the depths of its belly.
This form of Urshifu is a strong believer in the\none-hit KO. Its strategy is to leap in close to foes\nand land a devastating blow with a hardened fist.
Inhabiting the mountains of a distant region, this\nPokémon races across sheer cliffs, training its legs\nand refining its moves.
Within dense forests, this Pokémon lives in a pack\nwith others of its kind. It’s incredibly aggressive,\nand the other Pokémon of the forest fear it.
Once the vines on Zarude’s body tear off, they\nbecome nutrients in the soil. This helps the plants\nof the forest grow.
This Pokémon is a cluster of electrical energy.\nIt’s said that removing the rings on Regieleki’s\nbody will unleash the Pokémon’s latent power.
Its entire body is made up of a single organ that\ngenerates electrical energy. Regieleki is capable\nof creating all Galar’s electricity.
An academic theory proposes that Regidrago’s\narms were once the head of an ancient dragon\nPokémon. The theory remains unproven.
Its body is composed of crystallized dragon\nenergy. Regidrago is said to have the powers of\nevery dragon Pokémon.
Glastrier emits intense cold from its hooves.\nIt’s also a belligerent Pokémon—anything it\nwants, it takes by force.
Glastrier has tremendous physical strength, and\nthe mask of ice covering its face is 100 times\nharder than diamond.
It probes its surroundings with all its senses save\none—it doesn’t use its sense of sight. Spectrier’s\nkicks are said to separate soul from body.
As it dashes through the night, Spectrier absorbs\nthe life-force of sleeping creatures. It craves\nsilence and solitude.
Calyrex is a merciful Pokémon, capable of\nproviding healing and blessings. It reigned over\nthe Galar region in times of yore.
Calyrex is known in legend as a king that ruled\nover Galar in ancient times. It has the power to\ncause hearts to mend and plants to spring forth.
This Rotom has possessed a convection\nmicrowave oven that uses a special motor.\nIt also has a flair for manipulating flames.
This form of Rotom enjoys making mischief by\nturning up the heat. It will gleefully burn your\nfavorite outfit.
This form of Rotom enjoys coming up with water-\nbased pranks. Be careful with it if you don’t want\nyour room flooded.
This Rotom has possessed a washing machine\nthat uses a special motor. It blasts out water to\nget enemies to back down.
Rotom assumes this form when it takes over a\nrefrigerator powered by a special motor.\nIt battles by spewing cold air.
When it’s like this, Rotom likes to play pranks\nthat are freezing cold. You may find it’s turned\nthe bath you just filled to solid ice!
In this form, Rotom applies its new power over\nwind to its love of pranks. It will happily blow\naway any important documents it can find.
This Rotom has taken over a fan that has\na special motor. Its gusts of wind blow its\nopponents away!
This is Rotom after it’s seized control of a lawn\nmower that has a special motor. As it mows\ndown grass, it scatters the clippings everywhere.
In this form, Rotom focuses its antics on plants.\nAny flowers you were growing are going to\nget mowed down.
Blue-striped Basculin used to be a common food\nsource. They apparently have an inoffensive,\nlight flavor.
Known for their violence, these Pokémon\nhave the most fights with schools of red-\nstriped Basculin.
Through meditation, it calms its raging spirit and\nhones its psychic powers.
When wounded, it stops moving. It goes as\nstill as stone to meditate, sharpening its mind\nand spirit.
The sameness of Reshiram’s and Kyurem’s genes\nallowed Kyurem to absorb Reshiram. Kyurem can\nnow use the power of both fire and ice.
It has foreseen that a world of truth will arrive\nfor people and Pokémon. It strives to protect\nthat future.
It’s said that this Pokémon battles in order to\nprotect the ideal world that will exist in the\nfuture for people and Pokémon.
The sameness of Zekrom’s and Kyurem’s genes\nallowed Kyurem to absorb Zekrom. Kyurem can\nnow use the power of both electricity and ice.
Females are a bit more selfish and aggressive\nthan males. If they don’t get what they want,\nthey will torment you with their psychic abilities.
If it doesn’t hold back when it unleashes its\npsychic power, it can tear apart a tanker.\nIts unfriendliness is part of its charm.
This stance is dedicated to offense. It can cleave\nany opponent with the strength and weight of its\nsteel blade.
Once upon a time, a king with an Aegislash\nreigned over the land. His Pokémon eventually\ndrained him of life, and his kingdom fell with him.
When taking spirits to the afterlife, small\nPumpkaboo prefer the spirits of children to\nthose of adults.
Small Pumpkaboo are said to be the product of\nareas where few lost souls lingered.
When taking spirits to the afterlife, large\nPumpkaboo prefer the spirits of adults to\nthose of children.
Large Pumpkaboo are said to be the product of\nareas where many lost souls lingered.
Supersized Pumpkaboo are very partial to\nthe spirits of people who were of similarly\nsuperior proportions.
Massive Pumpkaboo are said to be the product\nof areas where a great number of lost\nsouls lingered.
Small Gourgeist pretend to be children to fool\nadults. Anyone who falls for the act gets carried\naway to the hereafter.
A small-sized Pumpkaboo evolves into\na small-sized Gourgeist. Its bodily proportions\nalso get passed on to its descendants.
Large Gourgeist put on the guise of adults,\ntaking the hands of children to lead them to\nthe afterlife.
A large-sized Pumpkaboo evolves into\na large-sized Gourgeist. Its bodily proportions\nalso get passed on to its descendants.
Supersized Gourgeist aren’t picky. They will\nforcefully drag anyone off to the afterlife.
A supersized Pumpkaboo evolves into\na supersized Gourgeist. Its bodily proportions\nalso get passed on to its descendants.
This Pikachu wears its partner’s cap, which is\nbrimming with memories of traveling through\nmany different regions.
This Pikachu is wearing its Trainer’s cap.\nThe cap is proof that the two traveled\nacross many regions together.
It’s believed that the weather, climate, and food\nof the Alola region all play a part in causing\nPikachu to evolve into this form of Raichu.
This Pokémon rides on its tail while it uses\nits psychic powers to levitate. It attacks with\nstar-shaped thunderbolts.
Life on mountains covered with deep snow has\ngranted this Pokémon a body of ice that’s as hard\nas steel.
It lives in snowy mountains on southern islands.\nWhen a blizzard rolls in, this Pokémon hunkers\ndown in the snow to avoid getting blown away.
It uses large, hooked claws to cut a path through\ndeep snow as it runs. On snowy mountains, this\nSandslash is faster than any other Pokémon.
Many people climb snowy mountains, hoping to\nsee the icy spikes of these Pokémon glistening\nin the light of dawn.
After long years in the ever-snowcapped\nmountains of Alola, this Vulpix has gained\npower over ice.
If you observe its curly hairs through\na microscope, you’ll see small ice\nparticles springing up.
A deity resides in the snowy mountains where this\nPokémon lives. In ancient times, it was worshiped\nas that deity’s incarnation.
While it will guide travelers who get lost on a\nsnowy mountain down to the mountain’s base,\nit won’t forgive anyone who harms nature.
The metal-rich geology of this Pokémon’s habitat\ncaused it to develop steel whiskers on its head.
Its three hairs change shape depending on\nDiglett’s mood. They’re a useful communication\ntool among these Pokémon.
Their beautiful, metallic whiskers create a sort of\nprotective helmet on their heads, and they also\nfunction as highly precise sensors.
The three of them get along very well.\nThrough their formidable teamwork, they\ndefeat powerful opponents.
It’s accustomed to luxury because it used to live\nwith Alolan royalty. As a result, it’s very picky\nabout food.
Deeply proud and keenly smart, this Pokémon\nmoves with cunning during battle and relentlessly\nattacks enemies’ weak points.
The round face of Alolan Persian is considered to\nbe a symbol of prosperity in the Alola region, so\nthese Pokémon are very well cared for.
This Pokémon is one tough opponent. Not only\ndoes it have formidable physical abilities, but it’s\nalso not above fighting dirty.
Blazing sunlight has brought out the true form\nand powers of this Pokémon.
This Pokémon’s psychic powers aren’t as strong\nas they once were. The head on this Exeggutor’s\ntail scans surrounding areas with weak telepathy.
This Pokémon sets the bone it holds on fire and\ndances through the night as a way to mourn its\nfallen allies.
The cursed flames that light up the bone carried\nby this Pokémon are said to cause both mental\nand physical pain that will never fade.
This form of Lycanroc is reckless. It charges\nheadlong at its opponents, attacking without any\ncare about what injuries it might receive.
It’s invigorated by powerful opponents—the\nstronger the better. A full-force headbutt from\none of these Lycanroc can shatter giant boulders.
On their own, they’re very weak. But when\nWishiwashi pool their power together in a\nschool, they become a demon of the sea.
When facing tough opponents, they get into\nformation. But if they get wounded in battle,\nthey’ll scatter and become solitary again.
Thanks to its awakened powers, it can change to\nthe Fighting type to match the memory it\nhas equipped.
It has the ability to change its type based\non the memory it’s holding. This is its\nFighting-type form.
Thanks to its awakened powers, it can change to\nthe Flying type to match the memory it\nhas equipped.
It has the ability to change its type based\non the memory it’s holding. This is its\nFlying-type form.
Thanks to its awakened powers, it can change to\nthe Poison type to match the memory it\nhas equipped.
It has the ability to change its type based\non the memory it’s holding. This is its\nPoison-type form.
Thanks to its awakened powers, it can change to\nthe Ground type to match the memory it\nhas equipped.
It has the ability to change its type based\non the memory it’s holding. This is its\nGround-type form.
Thanks to its awakened powers, it can change to\nthe Rock type to match the memory it\nhas equipped.
It has the ability to change its type based\non the memory it’s holding. This is its\nRock-type form.
Thanks to its awakened powers, it can change to\nthe Bug type to match the memory it\nhas equipped.
It has the ability to change its type based\non the memory it’s holding. This is its\nBug-type form.
Thanks to its awakened powers, it can change to\nthe Ghost type to match the memory it\nhas equipped.
It has the ability to change its type based\non the memory it’s holding. This is its\nGhost-type form.
Thanks to its awakened powers, it can change to\nthe Steel type to match the memory it\nhas equipped.
